phalasarneus: <entryFree id="n35907" type="main" key="Phalasarne_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phalasarnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*falasarnei=os</foreign>, <sense id="n35907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Cretan city of Phalasarne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phalasarnean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phalerae: <entryFree id="n35908" type="greek" key="pha^le^rae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălĕrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<sense id="n35908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> phalera posita, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 18</bibl>; Jan. phaleras), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ fa/lara</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n35908.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n35908.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shining ornament for the breast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a metal disc</hi> or <hi rend="ital">boss</hi>, worn by men, esp. as a military decoration: <cit><quote lang="la">phalerae sunt belli ornamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 554, 15 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 12, § 29</bibl>: phaleris et torque aliquem donare <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">phaleras deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">phaleris hic pectora fulget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:255" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 255</bibl></cit>.—As a military mark of distinction: <cit><quote lang="la">equites donati phaleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 458</bibl> Heyn. and Wagn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 60</bibl>.—Worn by women: matrona ornata phaleris pelagiis, P. Syrus ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n35908.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A trapping for the forehead and breast of horses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus equum phaleris insignem victor habeto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 310</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 103</bibl>.—As a trapping for elephants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 5, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35908.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an external ornament</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decoration</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): ad populum phaleras! <hi rend="ital">trappings for the people!</hi> who allow themselves to be deceived by externals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:30" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 30</bibl>.—Of rhetorical ornament, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 221</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 83" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heroicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
phalereus: <entryFree id="n35909" type="main" key="Pha^le_reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălēreus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Phalerum.</entryFree>
phaleris: <entryFree id="n35910" type="main" key="pha^le_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălēris</orth>, v. 1. phalaris.</entryFree>
phalero: <entryFree id="n35911" type="main" key="pha^le^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phălĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>phalerae</etym>, <sense id="n35911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to adorn with trappings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament the breast</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">animalia phalerari sibi magis quam nodari gaudent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Cant. Cantic. 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—Fig., <hi rend="ital">to deck</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">display</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae phalerandae gratiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. Min. 1, 12, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">phălĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <orth extent="full" lang="la">I</orth>. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wearing an ornament for the forehead and breast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba Mazacum atque cursorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35911.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">decorated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornamented</hi>: phaleratis dictis aliquem ducere, <hi rend="ital">with fine speeches</hi>, Ter Phorm. 3, 2, 16.</sense></entryFree>
phalerum: <entryFree id="n35912" type="main" key="Pha^le_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălērum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*falhro/n</foreign>, <sense id="n35912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the oldest harbor of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connected with the city by a long wall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a demos of the same name belonging to it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n35912.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălēreus</orth> (mostly trisyl.), ĕi and <itype>ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*falhreu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Phalerum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Phalerian</hi>: Demetrius Phalereus, or simply Phalereus, <hi rend="ital">a ruler of Athens and a famous orator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi> B. C. 300, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 6, 4</bibl>.—Scanned as a quadrisyllable: <cit><quote lang="la">Demetrius, qui dictus est Phalereus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phalerea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:80" default="NO">10, 1, 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35912.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*falhriko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Phalerian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phălērĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. portus), = Phalerum, in Phalericum descendere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 2, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Phalerico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phaleucius: <entryFree id="n35913" type="main" key="Pha^leuci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăleucĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Phalaecus.</entryFree>
phaliscus: <entryFree id="n35914" type="main" key="Phaliscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phaliscus</orth>, v. Faliscus.</entryFree>
phallovitrobolus: <entryFree id="n35915" type="main" key="phallovitrobo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phallovitrobŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-vitro-bŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking-vessel shaped like a phallus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pertin. 8, 5</bibl> dub. (Momms. vitro, fundibuli).</sense></entryFree>
phallus: <entryFree id="n35916" type="greek" key="phallus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fallo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure of an obscene shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carried about at the festival of Bacchus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originally a symbol of the generative power of nature; a phallus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 176</bibl>; cf. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 21.</sense></entryFree>
phanae: <entryFree id="n35917" type="main" key="Pha^nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phănae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fanai/</foreign>, <sense id="n35917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harbor and promontory in the isle of Chios</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noted</hi> <cb n="PHAR" /> <hi rend="ital">for its wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 43, 11</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35917.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phănaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phanœan</hi>: rex Phanaeus, <hi rend="ital">the king of Phanœ</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> of <hi rend="ital">Phanœan wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phanerosis: <entryFree id="n35918" type="greek" key="pha^ne^ro_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phănĕrōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fane/rwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n35918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a manifestation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revelation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haer. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phanote: <entryFree id="n35919" type="main" key="Pha^no^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phănŏtē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phănŏtēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fano/th, *fano/teia</foreign>, <sense id="n35919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35919.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a castle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35919.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Phocis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> Panope, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phantasia: <entryFree id="n35920" type="greek" key="phanta^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phantăsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fantasi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n35920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancy</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Nicetas longe disertius hanc phantasiam movit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor tuum phantasias patitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 34, 6</bibl></cit>.—As a term of reproach: phantasia, non homo, <hi rend="ital">a mere notion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the mere semblance of a man</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 11, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 8 al.</bibl>, written as Greek, and translated visum).— </sense><sense id="n35920.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A phantom</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apparition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animus) colli-git visa nocturna, quas phantasias nos adpellamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phantasma: <entryFree id="n35921" type="greek" key="phantasma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phantasma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fa/ntasma</foreign>. <sense id="n35921.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An apparition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phantom</hi> (postAug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">idolon, imago, simulacrum): velim scire, esse phantasmata et habere figuram ... an inania, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si phantasma fuit Christus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 14, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 6, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35921.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phantasm</hi> of an object (late Lat. for visum, imago, species): <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandriam cum eloqui volo, quam nunquam vidi, praesto est apud me phantasma ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trinit. 8:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trinit. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phantasmaticus: <entryFree id="n35922" type="main" key="phantasma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phantasmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>phantasma</etym>, <sense id="n35922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fantastic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imaginary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 8, 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phantasos: <entryFree id="n35923" type="main" key="Phanta^sos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phantăsos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/ntasos</foreign>, <sense id="n35923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Somnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 642</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phantastice: <entryFree id="n35924" type="main" key="phantasti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phantastĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n35924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by the fancy</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Nebrid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phantasticus: <entryFree id="n35925" type="greek" key="phantasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phantastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fantastiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imaginary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> An. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaon: <entryFree id="n35926" type="main" key="Pha^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n35926.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A youth of Lesbos beloved by Sappho without return</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 8, 9, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:35:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 35, 18</bibl>.—As a prov. of coldness, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35926.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a freedman of the emperor Nero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl> and 49.</sense></entryFree>
pharaeus: <entryFree id="n35927" type="main" key="Pha^raeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n35927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Pharœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pharœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:163" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pharanitis: <entryFree id="n35928" type="main" key="pha_rani_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phāranītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n35928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pharanitis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of amethyst</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharao: <entryFree id="n35929" type="main" key="Pha^ra^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărăo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*faraw/</foreign> (Hebrew <foreign />), <sense id="n35929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pharaoh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the title of the Egyptian kings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pharao nomen est non hominis, sed honoris, sicut apud nos Augusti appellantur reges, cum propriis nominibus censeantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 7, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 12, 15</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
pharetra: <entryFree id="n35930" type="greek" key="pha^re_^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phărē^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fare/tra</foreign>. <sense id="n35930.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a quiver</hi> for holding arrows (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">succinctam pharetrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec venenatis gravida sagittis, Fusce, pharetra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetram solvere,</quote> <trans><tr>to undo</tr>, <tr>open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatricis puellae (Dianae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pharetrā suā abscondit me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 49, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:38" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:607" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 607</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:259 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 259 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n35930.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of sundial in the form of a quiver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharetratus: <entryFree id="n35931" type="main" key="pha^re_^tra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phărē^trātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pharetra</etym>, <sense id="n35931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wearing a quiver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quivered</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pharetrata Camilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Geloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cupid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Semiramis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pharetrazonium: <entryFree id="n35932" type="gloss" key="pha^retrazo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăretra-zōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quiverbelt</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharetriger: <entryFree id="n35933" type="main" key="pha^re_^tri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phărē^trĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pharetragero</etym>, <sense id="n35933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">quiver-bearing</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): clade pharetrigeri regis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the Persian king Xerxes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:286" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 286</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pharia: <entryFree id="n35934" type="main" key="Pha^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭa ūva</orth>, <sense id="n35934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grape in the neighborhood of Pisa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phariacus: <entryFree id="n35935" type="main" key="Pha^ri^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pharus, A.</entryFree>
pharicon: <entryFree id="n35936" type="greek" key="pha_ri^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phārĭcon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fariko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n35936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so named from its inventor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pharicus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 41, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharis: <entryFree id="n35937" type="main" key="Pha_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa=ris</foreign>, <sense id="n35937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Messenia</hi>,<pb n="1368" /> <cb n="PHAR" />  <hi rend="ital">afterwards called</hi> Pharae or Pherae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:226" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 226</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharisaeus: <entryFree id="n35938" type="main" key="Pha^ri^saeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭsaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farisai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n35938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pharisee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a member of the Jewish sect</hi> of that name, usually in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭsaei</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharīsaei</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 574</bibl>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farisai=oi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Pharisees</hi>, a Jewish sect (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 7, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 221</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 2, 16</bibl> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundum legem Pharisaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35938.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farisai=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Pharisœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35938.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭsăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farisaiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Pharisaic</hi>: sepulcra, Hier. adv. Vigil. n. 9.</sense></entryFree>
pharitae: <entryFree id="n35939" type="main" key="Pha^ri_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Pharus, C. and B.</entryFree>
pharmaceuticus: <entryFree id="n35940" type="greek" key="pharma^ceuti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharmăceutĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <foreign lang="greek">farmakeutiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to drugs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pharmaceutical</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:10:126" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 10, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharmaceutria: <entryFree id="n35941" type="greek" key="pharma^ceutri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharmăceutrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">farmakeu/tria</foreign>, <sense id="n35941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sorceress</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
pharmacopola: <entryFree id="n35942" type="greek" key="pharma^co^po_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharmăcŏpōla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">farmakopw/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n35942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vender of medicines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a quack</hi> (class.), Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumforaneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 14, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharmacus: <entryFree id="n35943" type="greek" key="pharma^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharmăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">farmako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poisoner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sorcerer</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 107, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharmacusa: <entryFree id="n35944" type="main" key="Pharma^cu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharmăcūsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farmakou=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n35944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south-west from Miletus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Cœsar was taken by pirates</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Farmako</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharnabazus: <entryFree id="n35945" type="main" key="Pharna^ba_zus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharnăbāzus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farna/bazos</foreign>, <sense id="n35945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pharnabazus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Persian satrap under Darius Nothus and Artaxerxes</hi>, 412 to 377 B.C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:1 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 4, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
pharnaceon: <entryFree id="n35946" type="greek" key="pharna^ce_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharnăcēon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. pharnacion.</entryFree>
pharnaces: <entryFree id="n35947" type="main" key="Pharna^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharnăces</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*farna/khs</foreign>. <sense id="n35947.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of two kings of Pontus.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35947.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Grandfather of Mithridates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 54, § 151</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35947.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Mithridates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defeated by Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 476</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35947.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a slave of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 30, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 44, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharnacion: <entryFree id="n35948" type="main" key="pharna^ci_o^n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharnăcīŏn</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ēon</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">farna/keion</foreign>, <sense id="n35948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the plant panax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named for Pharnaces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 14, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharnuprium: <entryFree id="n35949" type="main" key="pharnuprium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pharnuprium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of figwine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 102</bibl> Jan.</sense></entryFree>
pharos: <entryFree id="n35950" type="main" key="Pha^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Pharus.</entryFree>
pharsalos: <entryFree id="n35951" type="main" key="Pharsa_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharsālos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharsālus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/rsalos</foreign>, <sense id="n35951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Cœsar defeated Pompey</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fersala</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:23" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 350</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35951.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharsālĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pharsalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pharsalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <trans><tr>Cœsar's victory over Pompey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 823</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35951.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharsālĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pharsalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugna,</quote> <trans><tr>in which Cœsar defeated Pompey</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 8, 23</bibl></cit> B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 32, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 37</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pharsālĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the region about Pharsalus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:823" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 823</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:50 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 50 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n35951.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An epic poem by Lucan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:985" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 985</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pharus: <entryFree id="n35952" type="main" key="Pha^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/ros</foreign>. <sense id="n35952.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island near Alexandria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where King Ptolemy Philadelphus built a famous light-house</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hence called</hi> pharus, now <hi rend="ital">Faro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 6</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 19.—</sense><sense id="n35952.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the lighthouse in the island of Pharos</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pharus est in insulā turris, magnā altitudine, mirificis operibus exstructa, quae nomen ab insulā accepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superposuit turrem in exemplum Alexandrini Phari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 83</bibl>; of other <hi rend="ital">light-houses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharon subiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:84" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris phari terrae motu Capreis concidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrrhena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:76" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35952.2" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Egypt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regina Phari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:102" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petimus Pharon arvaque Lagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 433</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n35952.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pharus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pharian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Egyptian</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sistra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 127, 11</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n35952.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/rios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pharus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pharian;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">the lighthouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1004" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 1004</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">Egyptian</hi>: Pharia juvenca, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Io</hi>, <cb n="PHAS" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:619" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 619</bibl>; but <hi rend="ital">Isis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">nence, turba,</quote> <trans><tr>the priests of Isis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:32" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cleopatra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:11:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <trans><tr>the lamentations of the Egyptian women at the festival of Isis for the lost Osiris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:244" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the crocodile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:85" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 85</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Isis</hi>: SACRVM PHARIAE, Vet. Kalend. ap. Grut. 138.—</sense><sense id="n35952.5" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phărītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pharos</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 19.—</sense><sense id="n35952.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small island on the coast of Dalmatia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formerly called Paros</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Parus</hi>), now <hi rend="ital">Lesina</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phascola: <entryFree id="n35953" type="gloss" key="phasco_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phascōla</orth> <itype>appellant Graeci, quas vulgus peras vocat</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=223" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 223</bibl> Mull. ( = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ fa/skwla</foreign>, <sense id="n35953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wallet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrip</hi>).</sense></entryFree>
phase: <entryFree id="n35954" type="main" key="Phase"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phase</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, <sense id="n35954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Passover</hi>, a Jewish feast commemorative of the rescue of the first-born among the Jews from the destruction which visited the Egyptians: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim Phase (id est transitus) Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum est Phase,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:23:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4 Reg. 23, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35954.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sacrifice offered at the Passover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the paschal lamb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immolare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 35, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 16, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaselaria: <entryFree id="n35955" type="main" key="pha^se_la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăsēlārĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">făsēl-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">făcēl-</orth>), <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>faselus</etym>, <sense id="n35955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dish of pickled French beans</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 20, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaselis: <entryFree id="n35956" type="main" key="Pha^se_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăsēlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fashli/s</foreign>. <sense id="n35956.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Lycia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Pamphylia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tekrova</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Verr 2, 4, 10, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 23 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35956.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăsēlītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fashli=tai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Phaselis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Phaselians</hi> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Phaselitūm), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 19, 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35956.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Judea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a neighboring valley abounding in palmtrees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 251</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35956.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăsēlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phaselis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 49, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaselus: <entryFree id="n35957" type="greek" key="pha^se_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăsēlus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">phăsell-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">făs-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fa/shlos</foreign>. <sense id="n35957.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of bean with an edible pod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">French beans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kidney-beans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phasel</hi> (phaseolus vulgaris of Linn.): <cit><quote lang="la">viciamque seres vilemque phaselum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa fasellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:377" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 377</bibl></cit>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 10, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35957.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a light vessel</hi> (<hi rend="ital">in the shape of a kidney-bean</hi>) <hi rend="ital">made of wicker-work</hi> or <hi rend="ital">papyrus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sometimes also of burned and painted clay</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">celox, lembus): epistulam de phaselo dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phaselus ille quem videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phaselon solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare vela fictilibus phaselis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:127" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictam phaselon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 30, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phaseolus: <entryFree id="n35958" type="main" key="pha^se^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăsĕŏlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">făsĕŏlus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>phaselus, I.</etym>, <sense id="n35958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bean with an edible pod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">French beans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kidney-beans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phasel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:72" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:9:1" default="NO">12, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 40, § 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phasganion: <entryFree id="n35959" type="greek" key="pha^sga^ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phăsgănĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fasga/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n35959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sword-lily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gladiole</hi> (pure Lat. gladiolus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 88, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phasiacus: <entryFree id="n35960" type="main" key="Pha_si^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāsĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Phasis, B.</entryFree>
phasiana: <entryFree id="n35961" type="main" key="pha_si^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phāsĭāna</orth>, v. 1. Phasis, C.</entryFree>
phasianarius: <entryFree id="n35962" type="main" key="pha_si^a_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phāsĭānārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fās-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>phasiana</etym>, <sense id="n35962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pheasant-keeper</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phasianinus: <entryFree id="n35963" type="main" key="pha_si^a_ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phāsĭānīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n35963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to pheasants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pheasant-</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phasianus: <entryFree id="n35964" type="main" key="Pha_si^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāsĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāsĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, v. 1. Phasis, C. and D.</entryFree>
phasiolos: <entryFree id="n35965" type="greek" key="pha_si^o^los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phāsĭŏlos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fās-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fasi/olos</foreign>, <sense id="n35965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> isopyron, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 70, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phasis: <entryFree id="n35966" type="main" key="Pha_sis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis or ĭdos</itype> (<case>acc.</case> also Phasin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:22:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 22, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 10:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 10, 3</bibl>: <sense id="n35966.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Phasim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:367 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 367 al.</bibl></cit>; <case>voc.</case> Phasĭ, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 52</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa=sis</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n35966.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Colchis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which empties into the Euxine Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Rion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limosi Phasidos undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua jura cruentum Phasin habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:457" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 457</bibl></cit>: Phasidis ales, <hi rend="ital">a pheasant</hi> (v. in the foll. Phasiacus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 4, 6, 8</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra Phasin capi volunt, quod ambitiosam popinam instruat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 10:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35966.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a town and its harbor lying at the mouth of the Phasis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of the Milesians</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Poti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 13</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35966.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phasian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> <hi rend="ital">Colchian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pheasants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:45:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 45, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Colchian</hi>, a term applied to Medea; <case>acc.</case> Phasida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35966.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phā-sĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fasiako/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Phasis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phasian;</hi> also <usg type="style">poet.</usg> <hi rend="ital">Colchian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">angulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:439" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 261</bibl></cit>: corona, <hi rend="ital">which</hi> <cb n="PHER" /> <hi rend="ital">Medea presented to Creusa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:605" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 605</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales Phasiacis petita Colchis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the pheasant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35966.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāsĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fasiano/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Phasis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phasian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phasianae aves,</quote> <trans><tr>pheasants</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 67, § 132</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">phāsĭāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pheasant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 33, 39, § 114</bibl>.— More freq., <orth extent="full" lang="la">phāsĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fāsĭān-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Edict. Diocl. p. 14.—According to the myth, it is the metamorphosed <hi rend="ital">Itys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Tereus;</hi> v. Itys.—</sense><sense id="n35966.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phā-sĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fasia/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Phasis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phasian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> <hi rend="ital">Colchian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phasias Aeetine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Medea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 80</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāsĭas</orth>. <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Medea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 382</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n35967" type="main" key="Pha_sis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phāsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 1. Phasis, A.</entryFree>
phasma: <entryFree id="n35968" type="greek" key="phasma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phasma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fa/sma</foreign>, <sense id="n35968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apparition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spectre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phantom.</hi> </sense><sense id="n35968.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a comedy of Menander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 9</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n35968.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The title</hi> or <hi rend="ital">principal part of a farce by a mimograph named Catullus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamosum ut ageres phasma Catulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:186" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 186</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phatnae: <entryFree id="n35969" type="greek" key="Phatnae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phatnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fa/tnai</foreign>, <sense id="n35969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Cribs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the space between two stars in the constellation Cancer</hi> (pure Lat. Praesepia), Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1170</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
phaulius: <entryFree id="n35970" type="main" key="phauli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phaulĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fau/lios</foreign>, <sense id="n35970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bad;</hi> only in the term phauliae olivae, <hi rend="ital">a bad kind of olives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 15</bibl> (al. babbiae); <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaunos: <entryFree id="n35971" type="main" key="phaunos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phaunos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parasitic plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 92, § 244</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phaylleus: <entryFree id="n35972" type="spur" key="Pha^ylle_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phăyllēus</orth>, <itype>false reading for Phalaceus</itype>, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:504" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 504</bibl>.</entryFree>
phegeus: <entryFree id="n35973" type="main" key="Phe_geus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phēgeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fhgeu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Alphesibœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 244" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 244</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35973.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phēgēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phegeus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phegean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phegeius ensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 412</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35973.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phēgis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fhgi/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Phegeus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Alphesibœa; acc.</hi> Phegida, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 455</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pheleta: <entryFree id="n35974" type="greek" key="phe_le_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phēlēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fhlhth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n35974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cheat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rogue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">robber</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">latrones, quos pheletas Aegyptii vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phellandrion: <entryFree id="n35975" type="greek" key="phellandri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phellandrĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fella/ndrion</foreign>, <sense id="n35975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant with leaves like ivy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 101, § 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phellos: <entryFree id="n35976" type="greek" key="phellos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phellos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fe/llos</foreign>, <sense id="n35976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cork-tree;</hi> transf., <hi rend="ital">the part of the water-clock made from it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the cork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phemius: <entryFree id="n35977" type="main" key="Phe_mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phēmĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fh/mios</foreign>. <sense id="n35977.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated player on the cithara in Ithaca;</hi> hence, transf., of <hi rend="ital">a good cithara-player</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35977.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 680, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phemonoe: <entryFree id="n35978" type="main" key="Phe_mo^no^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phēmŏnŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fhmono/h</foreign>, <sense id="n35978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">priestess at Delphi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 8, 9, § 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 8, 8, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a prophetess</hi>, Lue. 5, 126; 187; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pheneos: <entryFree id="n35979" type="main" key="Phe^ne^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕnĕos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fe/neos</foreign>, <sense id="n35979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a lake of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fabled Stygian waters</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 332</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 165</bibl>.—The city is called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕnĕum</orth> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n35979.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕnĕātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fenea/tai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pheneüs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pheneans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phengites: <entryFree id="n35980" type="greek" key="phengi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phengītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">feggi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n35980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">phengite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">selenite</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">erystallized gypsum</hi>, used for window-panes: <cit><quote lang="la">in Cappadociā repertus est lapis candidus, atque translucens, ex argumento phengites appellatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 46, § 163</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pheos: <entryFree id="n35981" type="greek" key="phe^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĕos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fe/ws</foreign>, <sense id="n35981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prickly plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> stoebe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 54, § 91</bibl> (al. phleos); 22, 11, 13, § 28.</sense></entryFree>
pherae: <entryFree id="n35982" type="main" key="Phe^rae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fe/rai</foreign>, <sense id="n35982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities;</hi> the most celebrated are, </sense><sense id="n35982.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The capital of</hi> Thessalia Pelasgiotis, <hi rend="ital">the residence of Admetus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Velestino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:25:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 25, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 9</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35982.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pherœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pherœan;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, also, <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jason,</quote> <trans><tr>of Pherœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:28:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 28, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaccae,</quote> <trans><tr>of Admetus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duces,</quote> <trans><tr>Thessalian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:16:3" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <trans><tr>Thessalian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:444" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 444</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕraei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pherœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35982.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Messenia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of Sparta</hi>, near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Kalamata</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 30, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 1</bibl>. 1. <pb n="1369" /> <cb n="PHIL" /></sense></entryFree>
pherecleus: <entryFree id="n35983" type="main" key="Phe^re_^cle_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕrē^clēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fere/kleios</foreign>, <sense id="n35983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phercelus</hi> (who built the ships with which Paris carried off Helen), <hi rend="ital">Phereclean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pherecratius: <entryFree id="n35984" type="main" key="Phe^recra^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕrecrătĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n35984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Grecian poet Pherecrates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pherecratian</hi>: metrum dactylicum trimetrum Pherecratium constat ex spondeo, et dactylo, et spondeo, sive trocheo, ut est apud Horatium, grato, Pyrrha, sub antro, Mall. Theod. Metr. 4 (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 3</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in carm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pherecyadae: <entryFree id="n35985" type="main" key="Phe^re_cy^a^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕrēcyădae</orth>, v. Pheretiades, II.</entryFree>
pherecydes: <entryFree id="n35986" type="main" key="Phe^re^cy_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕrĕcȳdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fereku/dhs</foreign>. <sense id="n35986.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated philosopher from Syros</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an instructor of Pythagoras</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:50:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 50, 112</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">reputed to be the inventor of prose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 205</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35986.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕrĕcȳdēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pherecydes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pherecydean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pherecydeum illud,</quote> <trans><tr>that saying of Pherecydes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 13, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n35986.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Athenian chronicler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi> 480 B.C., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pheres: <entryFree id="n35987" type="main" key="Phe^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕres</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fe/rhs</foreign>, <sense id="n35987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Trojan; acc.</hi> Phereta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 413</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pheretiades: <entryFree id="n35988" type="main" key="Phe^re_ti^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕrētĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ferhtia/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n35988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Pheres</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Pherœ</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Admetus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35988.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĕrētĭădae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Phĕrēcyăd-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ferhtia/dai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Naples</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Neapolitans;</hi> so named after Pheres, king of Pheræ: <cit><quote lang="la">Pheretiadum muri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:159" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pheretus: <entryFree id="n35989" type="main" key="Phere_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pherētus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n35989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Jason and Medea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 239" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 239</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pherinum: <entryFree id="n35990" type="main" key="Pheri^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pherĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a castle in Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pherombros: <entryFree id="n35991" type="greek" key="phe^rombros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĕrombros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fero/mbros</foreign> (rain-bringing), <sense id="n35991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for</hi> cucumis silvaticus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pheugydros: <entryFree id="n35992" type="main" key="pheugy_^dro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pheugȳ^drŏs</orth>, <itype>ŏn</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">feu/gudros</foreign>, <sense id="n35992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hydrophobic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:9:98" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 9, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pheuxaspidion: <entryFree id="n35993" type="main" key="pheuxaspi^di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pheuxaspĭdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n35993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name of the plant</hi> polion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phiala: <entryFree id="n35994" type="greek" key="phi^a^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭăla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fia/lh</foreign>. <sense id="n35994.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shallow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drinking-vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a saucer</hi> (cf. patera), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:33:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:1" default="NO">8, 51, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:41:1" default="NO">3, 41, 1</bibl>; 14, 95 <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 156</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35994.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A censer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 28, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Apoc. 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n35995" type="main" key="Phi^a^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭăla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fia/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n35995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion of Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 172</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phidias: <entryFree id="n35996" type="main" key="Phi_di^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phīdĭas</orth> (first syll. short, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr 12, 1</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*feidi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n35996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous sculptor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Pericles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who made the celebrated statue of Jupiter Olympius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 146</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:257" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 73, 257</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:32:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 32, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 49</bibl>; Quint 10, 12, 8 sq.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Phidian, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 54</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n35996.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phīdĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phidias</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:13:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:66" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phidippides: <entryFree id="n35997" type="main" key="Phi_dippi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phīdippĭdes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phīlippĭdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*feidippi/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n35997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous courier at Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 20, 20, § 84</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Sillig ad h. l. —The same called Phidippus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phidippus: <entryFree id="n35998" type="main" key="Phi_dippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phīdippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fei/dippos</foreign>. <sense id="n35998.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Grandson of Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of Helen's suitors</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 80" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n35998.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous courier</hi>, v. Phidippides.—</sense><sense id="n35998.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A physician of king Deiotarus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
