phiditia: <entryFree id="n35999" type="main" key="phi_di^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phīdĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v philitia.</entryFree>
phidon: <entryFree id="n36000" type="main" key="Phi_don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phīdon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fei/dwn</foreign>, <sense id="n36000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a descendant of Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to whom is attributed the invention of weights and measures</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philadelphia: <entryFree id="n36001" type="main" key="Phi^la^delphi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlădelphīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filade/lfeia</foreign>, <sense id="n36001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an important city of Lydia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the town and ruins of Allasher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlădelphēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the city of Philadelphia in Lydia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Philadelphians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philadelphus: <entryFree id="n36002" type="main" key="Phi^la^delphus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlădelphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fila/delfos</foreign> (loving one's brother or sister), <sense id="n36002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian and Roman surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36002.1" n="I" level="1"> Ptolemaeus Philadelphus, <hi rend="ital">a king of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 14, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:17:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 17, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36002.2" n="II" level="1"> Annius Philadelphus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36002.3" n="III" level="1"> Philadelphus, <hi rend="ital">a slave of Atticus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. CALPVRNIVS L. L. PHILADELPHVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Veron. 274, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philae: <entryFree id="n36003" type="main" key="Phi^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ai( *fi/lai</foreign>, <sense id="n36003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Nile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south of Elephantine</hi>, <cb n="PHIL" /> <hi rend="ital">with a city of the same name</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Jeziret Anas-el-Wojond</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 313</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philaeni: <entryFree id="n36004" type="main" key="Phi^laeni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlaeni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (ōn), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fi/lainoi</foreign>, <sense id="n36004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two Carthaginian brothers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">out of love for their country</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submitted to be buried alive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 79:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 79, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6</bibl>, ext. 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 6</bibl>.—Philaenōn Arae, <hi rend="ital">a frontier town of Cyrene named after them</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the southernmost point of the Great Syrtis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Philaenorum Arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philammon: <entryFree id="n36005" type="main" key="Phi^lammon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlammon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fila/mmwn</foreign>, <sense id="n36005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated singer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 317</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 161" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philanthropia: <entryFree id="n36006" type="greek" key="phi^lanthro_pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlanthrōpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filanqrwpi/a</foreign> (philanthropy; hence), <sense id="n36006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a benevolence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a present</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gift</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">philanthropiae nomine (al. philanthropii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:14:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philanthropium: <entryFree id="n36007" type="main" key="phi^lanthro_pi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlanthrōpĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. philanthropia.</entryFree>
philanthropos: <entryFree id="n36008" type="greek" key="phi^lanthro_pos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlanthrōpos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fila/nqrwpos</foreign> (sc. herba), <sense id="n36008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">goose-grass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clivers</hi>: Galium aparine, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 116, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philargicus: <entryFree id="n36009" type="greek" key="phi^largi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlargĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fi/losa)rgiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of ease</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">philoso-phi tripartitam humanitatis voluerunt esse vitam, ex quibus primam theoreticam, secundam practicam, tertiam philargicam voluere, quas nos Latine contemplativam, activam, voluptariam nuncupamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philargyria: <entryFree id="n36010" type="main" key="phi^largy^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlargyrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filarguri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the love of money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">avarice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Reg. Monach. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philema: <entryFree id="n36011" type="greek" key="phi^le_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlēma</orth>, <itype>mătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fi/lhma</foreign>, <sense id="n36011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kiss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1169</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philemo: <entryFree id="n36012" type="main" key="Phi^le_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlēmo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filh/mwn</foreign>. <sense id="n36012.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek comic poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Soli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a contemporary of Menander</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. prol. 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 3, p. 353</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36012.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36012.2" n="III" level="1"> In mythology, <hi rend="ital">a pious rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the husband of Baucis</hi>, Ov M. 8, 631 sq.</sense></entryFree>
philetaeria: <entryFree id="n36013" type="greek" key="phi^le^taeri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlĕtaerĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlĕtae-ris</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filetai/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n36013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> polemonia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 28, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 8, 55, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philetas: <entryFree id="n36014" type="main" key="Phi^le_tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlētas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filh/tas</foreign>, <sense id="n36014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek elegiac poet of Cos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an instructor of Ptolemy Philadelphus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 58</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36014.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlētēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Philetas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Philetean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philetea aqua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>elegiac poetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit> (4, 2), 52: <cit><quote lang="la">Philetei corymbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 3.</sense></entryFree>
philippensis: <entryFree id="n36015" type="main" key="Phi^lippensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippensis</orth>, v. Philippi, A.</entryFree>
philippeus: <entryFree id="n36016" type="main" key="Phi^lippe_us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Philippi, B.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n36017" type="main" key="Phi^lippe_us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Philippus, A.</entryFree>
philippi: <entryFree id="n36018" type="main" key="Phi^lippi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fi/lippoi</foreign>, <sense id="n36018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for the battle in which Octavianus and Antony defeated Brutus and Cassius</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Filibi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:70:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 70, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil 1, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36018.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭ-lippensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Philippi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Philippian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippense bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <trans><tr>the battle of Philippi</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Brutus,</quote> <trans><tr>who fell at Philippi</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36018.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlip-pēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Philippi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Philippian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:86:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 86, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 906</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36018.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Philippi</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Philippian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Philippicis campis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 12, § 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:43" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36018.4" n="D" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Philippian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who fought at Philippi</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Ver. 325</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philippicus: <entryFree id="n36019" type="main" key="Phi^lippi^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Philippi, C.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n36020" type="main" key="Phi^lippi^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Philippus, B.</entryFree>
philippides: <entryFree id="n36021" type="main" key="Phi^lippides"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippides</orth>, v. Phidippides.</entryFree>
philippopolis: <entryFree id="n36022" type="main" key="Phi^lippo^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>ĕos</itype> (<case>acc.</case> -in or -im; <case>abl.</case> -i), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filippo/polis</foreign>. <sense id="n36022.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Thrace on the Hebrus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Philippopoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:53:13 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 53, 13 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36022.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Palestine</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the ruins of Ghereyah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 28:1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 28, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philippus: <entryFree id="n36023" type="main" key="Phi^lippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fi/lippos</foreign>, <sense id="n36023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Philip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the name of several kings of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the most celebrated of whom was the son of Amyntas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Reg. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 4 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 8, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n36023.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a gold coin struck by King</hi> <cb n="PHIL" /> <hi rend="ital">Philip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Philippe d'or</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 27</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 38</bibl>; 41; 78 al.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 234</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, in gen., of other coins,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36023.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n36023.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippēus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippĭus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 38</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fili/ppeios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Philip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Philippian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippeus sanguis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cleopatra</tr>, <tr>because the Egyptian sovereigns were descended from Philip of Macedon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9, 39</bibl></cit> (4, 10, 40): <cit><quote lang="la">Em tibi talentum argenti: Philippeum aes est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: Philippeus nummus, <hi rend="ital">a gold coin struck by Philip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the value of twenty drachmœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Philippe d'or</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi Philippei aurei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippeum aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>from which the Philippe d'or was struck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:70 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 70 al.</bibl></cit>— Hence, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a gold coin struck by Philip</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 78, 11</bibl>. —And, transf., of other coins: argenteos Philippeos minutulos, Val. Imp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36023.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filippiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Philip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Philippic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippicum talentum argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>a gold-mine of Philip's in Macedonia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 57</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Cicero's orations against Antony</hi> were called orationes Philippicae, after those of Demosthenes against King Philip, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 3</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">sing. collect.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlippĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">divina Philippica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 125</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philistaea: <entryFree id="n36024" type="main" key="Phi^listaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlistaea</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-thaea</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the southwestern portion of Canaan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Philistia;</hi> acc. to Hieronymus, <hi rend="ital">another name for Palœstina</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 14, 29</bibl> and 31.</sense></entryFree>
philistaeus: <entryFree id="n36025" type="main" key="Phi^listaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlistaeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-thaeus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Philistine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 17, 8</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
philistini: <entryFree id="n36026" type="main" key="Phi^listi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlistīni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-thīni</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭ-listhiim</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Philistines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the original inhabitants of Palestine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1 Reg. 28, 1</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
philistinus: <entryFree id="n36027" type="main" key="Phi^listi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlistīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: Philistinae Fossiones, <sense id="n36027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Philistine Fosses</hi>, at the mouth of the Po; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Philistina fossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philistion: <entryFree id="n36028" type="main" key="Phi^listi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlistĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filisti/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n36028.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 15, § 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36028.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pantomime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:41:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 41, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philistus: <entryFree id="n36029" type="main" key="Philistus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Philistus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fi/listos</foreign>, <sense id="n36029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a historian in Syracuse in the reign of the tyrant Dionysius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an imitator of Thucydides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 13, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philitia: <entryFree id="n36030" type="main" key="phi_li^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phīlĭtĭa</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">phīdĭtĭa</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fili/tia</foreign> (<foreign lang="greek">fidi/tia</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">feiditia</foreign>), <sense id="n36030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the public meals of the Lacedœmonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phillyrides: <entryFree id="n36031" type="main" key="Philly^ri^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phillyrĭdes</orth>, v. Phĭlyrĭdes, in 2. Philyra, B.</entryFree>
philo: <entryFree id="n36032" type="main" key="Phi^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fi/lwn</foreign>. <sense id="n36032.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Academic philosopher of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teacher of Cicero about</hi> A. U. C. 663, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:89:306" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 89, 306</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 37, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36032.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated architect in Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:14:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 14, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl> § 12; cf. Sillig, Catal. Artif. s. h. v.—</sense><sense id="n36032.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek physician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Tarsus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inventor of an eye-salve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Philo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philonianum antidotum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlōnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, the same, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 22, 396</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36032.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>: Q. Publicius Philo, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 439, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 291</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philocalia: <entryFree id="n36033" type="greek" key="phi^lo^ca^li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏcălĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filokali/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a love of the beautiful</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Cont. Acad. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Cont. Acad. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:2:3" default="NO">2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philochares: <entryFree id="n36034" type="main" key="phi^lo^cha^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏchăres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filoxare/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> philopaes <hi rend="ital">and</hi> marrubium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 241</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philocomasium: <entryFree id="n36035" type="main" key="Phi^lo^co_ma^si^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏcōmăsĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filokwma/sion</foreign> (tippling-friend), <sense id="n36035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philocteta: <entryFree id="n36036" type="main" key="Phi^locte_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭloctēta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭloctētes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (corrupted form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Philotes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 42, 7</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filokth/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n36036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Pœas of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated as an archer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a companion of Hercules</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who at his death gave him the poisoned arrows without which Troy could not be taken. On account of the stench proceeding from his wounded foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he was left by the Greeks on the isle of Lemnos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but was afterwards taken by Ulysses to Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Machaon healed his wound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and he slew Paris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 102" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 102</bibl> <pb n="1370" /> <cb n="PHIL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:313 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 313 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:7:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 30, 41</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭloctētaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filokthtai=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Philoctetes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Philoctetœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philodemus: <entryFree id="n36037" type="main" key="Phi^lo^de_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏdēmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filo/dhmos</foreign>, <sense id="n36037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Epicurean philosopher in the time of Cicero</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the author of a work</hi> <foreign lang="greek">peri\ mousikh=s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">and of several epigrams</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 119</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 68</bibl>, and Ascon. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
philograecus: <entryFree id="n36038" type="greek" key="phi^lograecus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlograecus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fi/los*graiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of Greek;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lover of the Greek language</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vos philograeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philolaus: <entryFree id="n36039" type="main" key="Phi^lo^la_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏlāus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filo/laos</foreign>, <sense id="n36039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pythagorean philosopher of Croton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple of Archytas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philologia: <entryFree id="n36040" type="greek" key="phi^lo^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filologi/a</foreign>. <sense id="n36040.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">love of learning</hi> or <hi rend="ital">letters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">literary pursuits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the study of polite literature</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne et opera et oleum philologiae nostrae perierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl> § <cit><quote lang="la">4: Homerus philologiae omnis dux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n36040.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">explanation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interpretation</hi> of the writings of others, <hi rend="ital">philology</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae philosophia fuit, facta est philologia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philologus: <entryFree id="n36041" type="greek" key="phi^lo^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">filo/logos</foreign>. <sense id="n36041.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to learning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">literary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philologis et philotechnis rebus me delectans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. 4: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Apoc. 5:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Apoc. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36041.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. of persons. </sense><sense id="n36041.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Scholarly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">versed in history</hi>, <hi rend="ital">antiquities</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and literature</hi> (implying a broader culture than grammaticus, litterator; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Krebs, Antibarb. 863 sq.): homines nobiles illi quidem, sed nullo modo philologi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 12, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> —</sense><sense id="n36041.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a person engaged in learned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">literary pursuits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a man of letters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">learned man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scholar</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Atteius Philologi appellationem assumpsisse videtur, quia, sicut Eratosthenes, qui primus hoc cognomen sibi vindicavit, multiplici variāque doctrinā censebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 10</bibl></cit>: cum Ciceronis librum de republicā prendit hinc philologus aliquis, hinc grammaticus, hinc philosophiae deditus, alius alio curam suam mittit; <cit><quote lang="la">... hoc subnotat (philologus): duos Romanos reges esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philomela: <entryFree id="n36042" type="main" key="Phi^lo^me_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏmēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filomh/lh</foreign>. <sense id="n36042.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Pandion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and sister of Progne; she was violated by her brother-in-law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tereus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was changed into a nightingale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondeo, Natas ex Philomelā atque ex Progne esse hirundines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 45" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:424 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 424 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 79</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:75:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 75, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36042.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the nightingale</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 511</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36042.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The swallow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalium penatibus fiducialis nidos philomela suspendit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 8, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36042.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a play</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philomelium: <entryFree id="n36043" type="main" key="Phi^lo^me_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏmēlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filomh/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n36043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Phrygia Major</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ak Shehr</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:83:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 83, § 191</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36043.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏmēlenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Philomelium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Philomelians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:83:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 83, § 191</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. Philomelienses); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 25, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philometor: <entryFree id="n36044" type="main" key="Phi^lo^me_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏmētor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filomh/twr</foreign> (mother-loving), <sense id="n36044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of Attalus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Pergamus; and also of the sixth Ptolemy of Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on account of his love for his mother Cleopatra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who had ruled the kingdom well during his minority</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 2, 7 sq.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of Attalus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 5, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philonianus: <entryFree id="n36045" type="main" key="Phi^lo_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlōnĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. Philo, III.</entryFree>
philopaes: <entryFree id="n36046" type="greek" key="phi^lo^paes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏpaes</orth>, <itype>paedis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filo/pais</foreign>, <sense id="n36046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marrubium nonnulli philopaeda vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 241</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philopator: <entryFree id="n36047" type="main" key="Phi^lo^pa^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏpător</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filopa/twr</foreign> (father-loving). <sense id="n36047.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An appellation of the fourth Ptolemy of Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestowed upon him in derision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">because he had murdered his father and mother</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 208</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 193</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36047.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36047.2" n="III" level="1"> With a Latin ending: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏpăter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1490, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philopoemen: <entryFree id="n36048" type="main" key="Phi^lo^poemen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏpoemen</orth>, <itype>ĕnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filopoi/uhn</foreign>, <sense id="n36048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated general of the Achœan</hi> <cb n="PHIL" /> <hi rend="ital">league</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 25</bibl> sqq.; 39, 49; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 29, 4, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philopygista: <entryFree id="n36049" type="main" key="phi^lo^py_gista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏpȳgista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filopugisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an abandoned person</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philorhomaeus: <entryFree id="n36050" type="main" key="Phi^lo^rho_maeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlŏrhōmaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filorw/maios</foreign>, <sense id="n36050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">friend</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lover of the Romans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a title given to Ariobarzanes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Cappadocia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philosarca: <entryFree id="n36051" type="greek" key="phi^lo^sarca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsarca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filo/sarkos</foreign>, <sense id="n36051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lover of the flesh</hi>, Auct. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philosophaster: <entryFree id="n36052" type="main" key="phi^lo^so^phaster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>philosophus</etym>, <sense id="n36052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bad philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a philosophaster</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 2, 27 dub.</sense></entryFree>
philosophe: <entryFree id="n36053" type="main" key="phi^lo^so^phe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphē</orth>, v. philosophus <sense id="n36053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
philosophia: <entryFree id="n36054" type="greek" key="phi^lo^so^phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filosofi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">philosophy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36054.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam aliud est philosophia, si interpretari velis, quam studium sapientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae in philosophiā tractantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars est enim philosophia vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 1, 15, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">videte ne quis vos decipiat per philosophiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36054.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36054.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A philosophical subject</hi> or <hi rend="ital">question</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus, in quo de philosophiā sermo habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36054.4" n="B" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">philosophical systems</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sects</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitatio propria duarum philosophiarum (i. e. Academicorum et Peripateticorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:27:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 27, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:3:8" default="NO">5, 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philosophice: <entryFree id="n36055" type="main" key="phi^lo^so^phi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. philosophicus <sense id="n36055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
philosophicus: <entryFree id="n36056" type="greek" key="phi^lo^so^phi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">filosofiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">philosophic</hi> (post-class.; <cit><quote lang="la">for the proper read.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 121</bibl></cit>, is philosophiae, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 134, 3</bibl>, and 174, 18), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1</bibl> Eyssen. (Jan. philosophis); <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Off. 2, 9, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a philosophical manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">philosophically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 14, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philosophor: <entryFree id="n36057" type="main" key="phi^lo^so^phor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n36057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [philosophus], <hi rend="ital">to apply one's self to philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to play the philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to philosophize</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">philosophatur quoque jam, non mendax modo'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 18</bibl>: philosophari est mihi necesse, at paucis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 1</bibl> (cited periphrastically ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. Trag. Rel. v. 417 Vahl., and p. 53 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed jam satis est philosophatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philosophumenos: <entryFree id="n36058" type="greek" key="phi^lo^so^phu_me^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphūmĕnos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fil-</orth>), <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">filosofou/menos</foreign>, <sense id="n36058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">philosophical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">problemata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit> Burs. dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 1:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit> Burs.</sense></entryFree>
philosophus: <entryFree id="n36059" type="greek" key="phi^lo^so^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">filo/sofos</foreign>, <sense id="n36059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">philosophical</hi>: philosopha sententia, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl></cit>, § 13.—</sense><sense id="n36059.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n36059.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭ-lŏsŏphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a philosopher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi denique ipsius, qui de suā vi ac sapientiā unus omnia paene profitetur, est tamen quaedam descriptio, ut is, qui studeat, omnium rerum divinarum atque humanarum vim, naturam causasque nosse et omnem bene vivendi rationem tenere et persequi, nomine hoc appelletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio tempore rhetorum praecepta tradere, alio philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: nemo aegrotus quicquam somniat tam infandum, quod non aliquis dicat philosophus, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 56, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:58:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 58, 119</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoici philosophi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36059.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏpha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female philosopher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea villa tamquam philosopha videtur esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>; so in apposition: philosopha anicula, Verus ap. Vulcat. Av<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cass. 1</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏsŏphē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">philosophically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his ipsis prooemiis philosophe scribere voluimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—Ironically, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philostorgus: <entryFree id="n36060" type="greek" key="phi^lostorgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlostorgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">filo/storgos</foreign>, <sense id="n36060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loving tenderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affectionate</hi>, esp. of the love of parents and children (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">philostorgus, cujus rei nomen apud Romanos nullum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Amic. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Amic. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> ad Verum, 7.—</sense><sense id="n36060.1" n="II" level="1"> Written PHILOSTERGVS, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 240, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philotechnus: <entryFree id="n36061" type="greek" key="phi^lo^technus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŏtechnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">filo/texnos</foreign>, <sense id="n36061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of the arts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to the</hi> <cb n="PHLE" /> <hi rend="ital">study of the arts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">philotechnic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 4.</sense></entryFree>
philoxenus: <entryFree id="n36062" type="main" key="Phi^loxe^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭloxĕnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filo/cenos</foreign> (hospitable), <sense id="n36062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Avianus Philoxenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 35, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philtrodotes: <entryFree id="n36063" type="greek" key="philtro^do^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">philtrŏdŏtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fi/ltron-do/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n36063.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> splenium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36063.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> peristereos, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
philtrum: <entryFree id="n36064" type="main" key="philtrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">philtrum</orth>,, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fi/ltron</foreign>, <sense id="n36064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a love-potion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">philter</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; only in <number>plur.</number>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">philtra Thessala vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:611" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 611</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
philus: <entryFree id="n36065" type="main" key="phi^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fi/los</foreign>, <sense id="n36065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beloved</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quam cito (mulieres) philorum obliviscerentur!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36066" type="main" key="Philus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Philus</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pilus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: L. Furius Philus, <hi rend="ital">a consul</hi> A. U. C. 618, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 25</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
philyra: <entryFree id="n36067" type="greek" key="phi^ly^ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlyra</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlŭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">filu/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n36067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the linden-tree</hi> (pure Lat. tilia): <cit><quote lang="la">rari (libri) in philyrae cortice subnotati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 136</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36067.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36067.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The inner bark of the linden-tree</hi>, of which bands for chaplets were made: <cit><quote lang="la">displicent nexae philyris coronae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:337" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 337</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 14, 25, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:31" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 2, 9, § 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36067.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sheet of the inner bark of the linden-tree prepared for writing upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a writing-tablet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 52</bibl> prooem.—</sense><sense id="n36067.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rind of the papyrus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 23, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36068" type="main" key="Phi^ly^ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlyra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*filu/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n36068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Oceanus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who bore to Saturn the Centaur Chiron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was changed into a linden-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:153" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 138" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 138</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36068.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlyrēĭus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlyrēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Philyrean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philyreius heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Chiron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 676</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philyreia (al. Philyrea) tecta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Chiron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:352" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 352</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36068.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phĭlyrĭdes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Phill-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Chiron</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the son of Philyra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:60" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 550</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:14:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 14, 6</bibl> (poët. met. grat. Phīllyr-).</sense></entryFree>
philyrinus: <entryFree id="n36069" type="greek" key="phi^ly^ri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phĭlyrĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">filu/rinos</foreign>, <sense id="n36069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of the inner bark of the linden-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phimus: <entryFree id="n36070" type="greek" key="phi_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phīmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fimo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dice-box</hi>, = fritillus: <cit><quote lang="la">mitteret in phimum talos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phineus: <entryFree id="n36071" type="main" key="Phi_neus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phīneus</orth>, <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype> (Gr. <sense id="n36071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> Phineas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:26:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 26, 10</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fineu/s</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n36071.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">King of Salmydessus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Thrace. He possessed the gift of prophecy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but was struck with blindness for having deprived his sons of sight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon a false accusation made against them by Idœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">their step-mother</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:425" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 425</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 19" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 209</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 339</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 355</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36071.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a blind man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:26:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 26, 10</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36071.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phīnēï-us</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phīnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phineus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phinean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phineïa domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">guttur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:131" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phineum venenum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves,</quote> <trans><tr>the Harpies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 154" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36071.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phīnī-des</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Phineus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:273" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 273</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36071.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Brother of Cepheus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who fought with Perseus about Andromeda</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and was changed by him into a stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phintia: <entryFree id="n36072" type="main" key="Phinti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phintĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Alicata</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Licata</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:83:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 83, § 192</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phintĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Phintia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Phintians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phintias: <entryFree id="n36073" type="main" key="Phinti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phintĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*finti/as</foreign>, <sense id="n36073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pythagorean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for his friendship with Damon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 7</bibl>, ext. 1.</sense></entryFree>
phlebotomia: <entryFree id="n36074" type="greek" key="phle^bo^to^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlĕbŏtŏmĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">flĕb-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flebotomi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blood-letting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phlebotomy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phlebotomiam adhibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:18:104" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 18, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phlebotomiā uti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phlebotomice: <entryFree id="n36075" type="greek" key="phle^bo^to^mi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlĕbŏtŏmĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flebotomikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n36075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blood-letting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phlebotomy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:3:39" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 3, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phlebotomo: <entryFree id="n36076" type="greek" key="phle^bo^to^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlĕbŏtŏmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">flĕb-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">flebotome/w</foreign>, <sense id="n36076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to let blood from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bleed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phlebotomize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:14:111" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 14, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum phlebotomandi necne sint aegrotantes ... non phlebotomati magno adjutorio privantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 13, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:13:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 2, 13, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phlebotomus: <entryFree id="n36077" type="greek" key="phle^bo^to^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlĕbŏtŏmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">flĕb-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fleboto/uos</foreign>, <sense id="n36077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lancet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fleam</hi>: phlebotomo <pb n="1371" /> <cb n="PHLO" /> uti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:19:121" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 19, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibendus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transverso phlebotomo percutere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phlegethon: <entryFree id="n36078" type="main" key="Phle^ge^thon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlĕgĕthon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*flege/qwn</foreign> (burning, blazing), <sense id="n36078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in the Lower World</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which ran with fire instead of water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chaos et Phlegethon loca nocte silentia late,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartareus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 551</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:522" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 522</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardenti freto Phlegethon harenas igneus tostas agens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 1018" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 1018</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oedip. 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 752" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agam. 752</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n36078.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlĕgĕthontēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phlegethontian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36078.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlĕgĕthontis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phlegethontian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:544" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 544</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phlegma: <entryFree id="n36079" type="greek" key="phlegma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlegma</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">flegma</orth>), <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flegma</foreign>, <sense id="n36079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clammy humor of the body</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phlegm</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">flegma dissolvere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 8, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 7, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phlegmaticus: <entryFree id="n36080" type="greek" key="phlegma^ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlegmătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">flegmatiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of phlegm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phlegmatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 7, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phlegmone: <entryFree id="n36081" type="greek" key="phlegmo^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlegmŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flegmonh/</foreign>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">phlegmōn</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flegmwn</foreign>, <sense id="n36081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burning heat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inflammation beneath the skin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 4, 13, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phlegon: <entryFree id="n36082" type="main" key="Phle^gon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlĕgon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fle/gwn</foreign> (burning), <sense id="n36082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the four horses of the sun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phlegontis: <entryFree id="n36083" type="spur" key="phle^gontis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlĕgontis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flegonti/s</foreign>, a false reading for phlogitis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 189</bibl>.</entryFree>
phlegra: <entryFree id="n36084" type="main" key="Phlegra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlegra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fle/gra</foreign>, <sense id="n36084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards called Pallene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the giants are fabled to have been struck with lightning when fighting with the gods</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:595" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 595</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:564" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 564</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 444" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 444</bibl>.— As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phlegra giganteo sparsa est quo sanguine tellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 28</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36084.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlegraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phlegrœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phlegraei campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:39" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:693" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 693</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:78:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 78, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36084.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36084.3" n="1" level="3"> Campi, <hi rend="ital">a plain abounding in sulphur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Puteoli and Naples</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Solfatara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:540" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 540</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the volcano of Vesuvius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:657" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 657</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36084.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of a bloody battle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pharsalus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 37.</sense></entryFree>
phlegraeus: <entryFree id="n36085" type="main" key="Phlegraeus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlegraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Phlegra, II.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36086" type="main" key="Phlegraeus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlegraeus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*flegrai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n36086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Centaurs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 378</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phlegyae: <entryFree id="n36087" type="main" key="Phle^gy^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlĕgyae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a predatory people from Thrace</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who destroyed the temple at Delphi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 414</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phlegyas: <entryFree id="n36088" type="main" key="Phle^gy^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlĕgyas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>acc.</case> -an, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:193" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 193</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*flegu/as</foreign>, <sense id="n36088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Mars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of the Lapithœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Ixion and Coronis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 618</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:713" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 713</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phleos: <entryFree id="n36089" type="main" key="phle^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlĕos</orth>, v. pheos.</entryFree>
phliasius: <entryFree id="n36090" type="main" key="Phli_a_si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlīāsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Phlius, A.</entryFree>
phliuntii: <entryFree id="n36091" type="main" key="Phli_unti^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlīuntĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Phlius <sense id="n36091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
