phlius: <entryFree id="n36092" type="main" key="Phli_u_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlīūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fliou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n36092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Peloponnesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Sicyon and Argolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the sources of the Æsopus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Polyfengo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 13</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36092.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlīāsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phlius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phliasian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:329" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 329</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36092.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlīāsĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Phliasians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36092.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phlī-untĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 8</bibl>. This passage Cicero afterwards corrected, and wrote Phliasii: Phliasios autem dici sciebam, et ita fac ut habeas: nos quidem sic habemus. Sed primo me <foreign lang="greek">a)nalogi/a</foreign> deceperat, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phloginos: <entryFree id="n36093" type="greek" key="phlo^gi^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlŏgĭnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flo/ginos</foreign>, <sense id="n36093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flamecolored gem</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 179</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phlogites: <entryFree id="n36094" type="greek" key="phlo^gi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlŏgītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flogi/ths</foreign>, i. q. phlogitis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37</bibl>.</entryFree>
phlogitis: <entryFree id="n36095" type="greek" key="phlo^gi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlŏgītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flogi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n36095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flamecolored gem</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 189</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phlomis: <entryFree id="n36096" type="greek" key="phlo^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlŏmis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flomi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mullein</hi> (pure Lat. verbascum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 74, § 121</bibl>; cf. phlomos.</sense></entryFree>
phlomos: <entryFree id="n36097" type="greek" key="phlo^mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlŏmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flo/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n36097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mullein</hi> (pure Lat. verbascum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 73, § 120</bibl>; cf. phlomis.</sense></entryFree>
phlox: <entryFree id="n36098" type="greek" key="phlox"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phlox</orth>, <itype>phlŏgis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">flo/c</foreign> (flame), <sense id="n36098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="PHOE" /> <hi rend="ital">flower</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 38, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoba: <entryFree id="n36099" type="greek" key="pho^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phŏba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fo/bh</foreign>, <sense id="n36099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a corymb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 53</bibl>; v. Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
phobetor: <entryFree id="n36100" type="main" key="Pho^be_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phŏbētor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fobh/twr</foreign>, <sense id="n36100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Morpheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 640</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phobodipsos: <entryFree id="n36101" type="greek" key="pho^bo^dipsos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phŏbŏdipsos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fobo/diyos</foreign>, <sense id="n36101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hydrophobia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:9:98" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 9, 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoca: <entryFree id="n36102" type="greek" key="pho_ca^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phōcă</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">phōcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fw/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n36102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-dog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sea-calf</hi> (pure Lat. vitula marina), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 432</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deformes phocae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 300</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:267" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 267</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 19</bibl>. Proteus had a span of seadogs: <cit><quote lang="la">Protea huc rexisse vias junctis super aequora phocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:319" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 319</bibl></cit>. A grandson of Cephisus is fabled to have been changed by Apollo into this animal, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 388</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phocaea: <entryFree id="n36103" type="main" key="Pho_caea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fwkai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maritime town of Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of the Athenians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose inhabitants fled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to escape from Persian domination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and founded Massilia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fouges</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Foggia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:17:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:121" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 30, 32, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 31 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 16, 4</bibl>, and v. 2. Phocis, B.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n36103.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcaeensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phocœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 35</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcaeenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Phocœans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 21, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 39, 12</bibl> Drak. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 4, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3:20" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 3, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36103.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phō-caei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Phocœans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5" default="NO">2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36103.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phocœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">murex,</quote> <trans><tr>which was taken near Phocœa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36103.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Massilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:52" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phocaicae Emporiae,</quote> <trans><tr>a Spanish town founded by the Massilians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:369" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 369</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36103.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcăis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phocœan;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Massilian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ballista,</quote> <trans><tr>constructed with great skill by the Massilians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:335" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 335</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36103.6" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Phocœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Phocœans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 37, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phocaicus: <entryFree id="n36104" type="main" key="Pho_ca^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Phocaea, C., and 2. Phocis, D.</entryFree>
phocais: <entryFree id="n36105" type="main" key="Pho_ca^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcăis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Phocaea, D.</entryFree>
phocenses: <entryFree id="n36106" type="main" key="Pho_censes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. Phocaea, E., and 2. Phocis, A.</entryFree>
phoceus: <entryFree id="n36107" type="main" key="Pho_ce_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Phocis, B.</entryFree>
phocii: <entryFree id="n36108" type="main" key="Pho_ci^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. 2. Phocis, C.</entryFree>
phocion: <entryFree id="n36109" type="main" key="Pho_ci^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fwki/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n36109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Athenian general</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Demosthenes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose life is written by Nepos.</hi></sense></entryFree>
phocis: <entryFree id="n36110" type="main" key="pho_cis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phōcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pear-tree on the isle of Chios</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36111" type="main" key="Pho_cis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fwki/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the country between Bœotia and Ætolia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which were the mountains of Parnassus and Helicon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Castalian spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the river Cephisus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 313</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:64" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 64</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n36111.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, erroneously, in consequence of the similarity in the sound, for <hi rend="ital">Phocœa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phocide relictā, Graii, qui nunc Massiliam colunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 7:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 340</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:256" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 256</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 16, 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36111.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Phocians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36111.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phocian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:348" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <trans><tr>Pylades</tr>, <tr>son of King Strophius of Phocis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36111.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcĭi</orth>, ōrum <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Phocians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36111.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phocian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from Parnassus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 143</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phocus: <entryFree id="n36112" type="main" key="Pho_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fw=kos</foreign>, <sense id="n36112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Æacus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was slain by his brother Peleus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 477</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 267</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoebas: <entryFree id="n36113" type="main" key="Phoebas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoebas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, v. Phoebus, C.</entryFree>
phoebe: <entryFree id="n36114" type="main" key="Phoe_be_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoēbē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*foi/bh</foreign>. <sense id="n36114.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The moongoddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Phœbus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Diana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Luna</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the moon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vento semper rubet aurea Phoebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 431</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 371</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebe venantibus assit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jaculatrix Phoebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 20, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innupta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 476</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:366" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 366</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36114.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">night</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:235" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 235</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36114.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Leda and sister of Helen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 77</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n36114.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Leucippus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:679" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 679</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoebeius: <entryFree id="n36115" type="main" key="Phoebe_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoebēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Phoebus, A.</entryFree>
phoebeum: <entryFree id="n36116" type="main" key="Phoebe_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoebēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*foibei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n36116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a temple of Phœbus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which a place near Sparta received its name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoebeus: <entryFree id="n36117" type="main" key="Phoebe_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoebēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Phoebus, B.</entryFree>
phoebigena: <entryFree id="n36118" type="main" key="Phoebi^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoebĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Phoebus-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n36118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Phœbus</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an appellation of Æsculapius</hi>,<cb n="PHOE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 773</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 12, 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoebus: <entryFree id="n36119" type="main" key="Phoebus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoebus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*foi=bos</foreign> (the radiant), <sense id="n36119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poetical appellation of Apollo as the god of light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi Phoebus Apollo Praedixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 251</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:62" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 27</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">the sun</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum rediens fugat astra Phoebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi pallidus orbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 256</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristior iccirco nox est, quam tempora Phoebi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 585</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36119.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoe-bēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phœbean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Apollinean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Æsculapius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <trans><tr>of Æsculapius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <trans><tr>of the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:389" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 389</bibl></cit>: ales, <hi rend="ital">the raven</hi>, so called because metamorphosed by Apollo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:4:17" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idmon,</quote> <trans><tr>son of Phœbus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:228" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circe,</quote> <trans><tr>daughter of Sol</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36119.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoe-bēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phœbean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Apollinean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampas,</quote> <trans><tr>the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans><tr>Daphne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:82" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodos,</quote> <trans><tr>where the worship of Apollo prevailed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes,</quote> <trans><tr>oracle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tripodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebeā morbos pellere arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:827" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 827</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36119.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoebas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a priestess of Apollo;</hi> hence <hi rend="ital">the inspired one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the prophetess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:400" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 400</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:165" default="NO" valid="yes">165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoenice: <entryFree id="n36120" type="main" key="Phoeni_ce_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenīcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenīca</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:20:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 20, 56</bibl>, v. Madv. ad loc.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Poenīcē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 4, 22</bibl> al.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*foini/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n36120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Phœnicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a country of Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially celebrated for the purple which came from there;</hi> its principal cities were Tyre and Sidon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 19, 17, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:190" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 26, 65, § 190</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:20:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 20, 56</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenīcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6</bibl>, §§ 678, 680; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 446</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 88</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36120.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A small island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called Ios</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36120.2" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A town of Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36120.3" n="4" level="3"> Vid. phoenicea.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n36120.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenīces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Phœnicians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated as the earliest navigators and as founders of many colonies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially of Carthage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:41:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 41, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 14</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenix</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a Phœnician</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Cadmus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 197</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36120.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Carthaginians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:730" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 730</bibl>; in <number>sing.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a Carthaginian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 25</bibl>.—<pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phœnician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">elate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 3, 13, § 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36120.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">phoenī-cĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">poenī-, foenī-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">foini/keos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">purple-red</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut phoeniceum florem habet aut purpureum, aut lacteum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 23, 94, § 164</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poeniceas vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poeniceum corium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>made purple-red with blows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36120.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phœnician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36120.8" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phœnician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsul,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Anna</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:595" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 595</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 288</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 714</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: Phoenissae, <hi rend="ital">the Phœnician women</hi>, the name of a tragedy by Euripides; also of one by Seneca.—</sense><sense id="n36120.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36120.10" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Theban</hi>, because Cadmus was a Phœnician: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Theb. 9, 527</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36120.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Carthaginian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:409" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:632" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 632</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoenissa agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:174" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 174</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Carthage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:312" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 312</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36120.12" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenīcĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the south-south-east wind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36121" type="main" key="phoeni_ce_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phoenīcē</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">phoenīcĕa</orth>, ae), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">foinike/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of barley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mouse-barley</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 65, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoenicia: <entryFree id="n36122" type="main" key="Phoeni_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenīcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Phoenice.</entryFree>
phoenicitis: <entryFree id="n36123" type="greek" key="phoeni_ci_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phoenīcītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">foiniki=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n36123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoenicius: <entryFree id="n36124" type="main" key="Phoeni_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Phoenice, C.</entryFree>
phoenicobalanus: <entryFree id="n36125" type="greek" key="phoeni_co^ba^la^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phoenīcŏbălănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">foinikoba/lanos</foreign>, <sense id="n36125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Egyptian date</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 22, 47, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoenicopterus: <entryFree id="n36126" type="greek" key="phoeni_copte^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phoenīcoptĕrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">foiniko/pteros</foreign>, <sense id="n36126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the flamingo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phenicopter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phoenicopteri linguam praecipui saporis esse, Apicius docuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 133</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 110:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 110, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:71" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 71</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:139" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoenicurus: <entryFree id="n36127" type="greek" key="phoeni_cu_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phoenīcūrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">foini/kouros</foreign>, <sense id="n36127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the redtail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">redstart</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:29:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 44</bibl>. § 86. <pb n="1372" /> <cb n="PHOR" /></sense></entryFree>
phoenicusa: <entryFree id="n36128" type="main" key="Phoeni_cu_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenīcūsa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Phoenīcussa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*foinikou=sa</foreign>, <sense id="n36128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Æolian islands</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Filicuri</hi>, Plin, 3, 9, 14, § 94.</sense></entryFree>
phoenissus: <entryFree id="n36129" type="main" key="Phoenissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. Phoenice, D.</entryFree>
phoenix: <entryFree id="n36130" type="main" key="Phoenix1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <sense id="n36130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Phœnician;</hi> v. 1. Phoenice, A.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36131" type="main" key="Phoenix2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phoenix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*foi=nic</foreign>. <sense id="n36131.0" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The son of Amyntor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was given by Peleus to Achilles as a companion in the Trojan war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 307</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 337</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:60" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 60</bibl>. He brought to Peleus the news of the death of Achilles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36131.1" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Agenor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Cadmus and Europa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 178" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36132" type="main" key="phoenix3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phoenix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> Phoenica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 393</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the phœnix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fabulous bird in Arabia. It was said to live</hi> 500 <hi rend="ital">years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and from its ashes a young phœnix arose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 42:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 42, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 2, 2, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:393" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 393</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:4:36" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 417</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pholoe: <entryFree id="n36133" type="main" key="Pho^lo^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phŏlŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*folo/h</foreign>. <sense id="n36133.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A forestclad mountain in Arcadia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Elis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:273" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:228" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 228</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36133.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the abode of the Centaurs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 198</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 138</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36133.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phŏlŏē-tĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mount Pholoe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Thessaly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Centaurs</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 230</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pholus: <entryFree id="n36134" type="main" key="Pho^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fo/los</foreign>, <sense id="n36134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Centaur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Ixion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 456</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 306</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 391</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 294</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:45" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phonascus: <entryFree id="n36135" type="greek" key="pho_nascus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phōnascus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fwnasko/s</foreign> (singing-master; hence), <sense id="n36135.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A teacher of singing and declamation</hi>: phonascus assum vocis suscitabulum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 176, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare operam phonasco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36135.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A musical director</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chorister</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">psalmorum hic modulator et phonascus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phonema: <entryFree id="n36136" type="greek" key="pho_ne_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phōnēma</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fōn-</orth>), <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fwnhma</foreign>, <sense id="n36136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a saying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Platonis fonemata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Eloqu. p. 236" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Eloqu. p. 236</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
phonolenides: <entryFree id="n36137" type="main" key="Pho^no_le^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phŏnōlĕnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Phonolenus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Lapitha</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 433</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phonos: <entryFree id="n36138" type="greek" key="pho^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phŏnos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fo/nos</foreign> (murder), <sense id="n36138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name of the plant</hi> atractylis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phorbas: <entryFree id="n36139" type="main" key="Phorbas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phorbas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fo/rbas</foreign>, <sense id="n36139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several mythic personages</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 414</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 322</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phorcis:
<entryFree id="n36140" type="main" key="Phorcis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phorcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. 2. Phorcus, A.
(† <sense id="n36140.0" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">phorcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, a false reading for porcus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>
phorcus: <entryFree id="n36141" type="main" key="Phorcus" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phorcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phorcys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phorcyn</orth>, <itype>ȳnos</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 690</bibl> P., but acc. to Serv., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 240</bibl>, these forms are not used in Lat.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fo/rkos, *fo/rkus</foreign>, and <foreign lang="greek">*fo/rkun</foreign>, <sense id="n36141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Neptune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Medusa and the other Gorgons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of the Grœœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was changed after death into a sea-god</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 11, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phorci chorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 240</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or, Phorci exercitus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sea-gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 824</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater Phorcys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:726" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 726</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 645</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36141.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phorcys</orth>, <itype>ydos</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Phorcis</orth>, ĭdis), <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female descendant of Phorcus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora Phorcydos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Medusa</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit> (4, 22), 8: <cit><quote lang="la">geminas habitasse sorores Phorcydas unius partitas luminis usum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Grœœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 773</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36141.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phorcȳnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdos and ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Phorcus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Medu-</hi> sa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 230</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 626</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phorimon: <entryFree id="n36142" type="main" key="pho^ri^mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phŏrĭmon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fo/rimon</foreign>, <sense id="n36142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of alum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 184</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phorineumvinum: <entryFree id="n36143" type="main" key="phorineum vi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phorineum vīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 8, 10, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phormio: <entryFree id="n36144" type="greek" key="phormi^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phormĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">form-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fo/rmion</foreign>, <sense id="n36144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wicker-work of reeds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a mat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a straw covering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12</bibl>; Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36145" type="main" key="Phormi^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phormĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n36145.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a parasite in Terence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a play of the same name.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n36145.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Peripatetic philosopher of Ephesus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who delivered a lecture in the presence of Hannibal on the duties of military commanders and on the art of war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 75</bibl>; hence, transf., of <hi rend="ital">a silly person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who talks about things which he does not understand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">egomet in multos jam Phormiones incidi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 77</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36145.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>: Sextus Clodius <cb n="PHRI" /> Phormio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phoroneus: <entryFree id="n36146" type="main" key="Pho^ro_neus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phŏrōneus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyll.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*forwneu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Inachus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Argos</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Io</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 124" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:143" default="NO">143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:225" default="NO">225</bibl>; 274; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:889" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 889</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n36146.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phŏrōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phoronean</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Argive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoroneis sub antris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:101" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36146.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phŏrō-nis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phoronean</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Argive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoronides latuere venae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the river Inachus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 115" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 115</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phorōnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Io</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 668</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 524</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phosphoreus: <entryFree id="n36147" type="main" key="phospho^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phosphŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Phosphorus</etym>, <sense id="n36147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the morning-star</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 147</bibl> (al. Bosphoreum).</sense></entryFree>
phosphorus: <entryFree id="n36148" type="greek" key="Phospho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phosphŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fwsfo/ros</foreign> (the light-bringer). <sense id="n36148.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The morning-star</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phosphore, redde diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:21:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 851</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, § 882</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36148.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name of Harpocrates</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 88, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
photinus: <entryFree id="n36149" type="main" key="Pho_ti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōtīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fwteino/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male proper name.</hi> So esp., <hi rend="ital">the bishop of Sirmium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">founder of a Christian sect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the adherents of which are called</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phōtīnĭāni</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phraates: <entryFree id="n36150" type="main" key="Phra^a_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrăātes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrăhātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (is), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fraa/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n36150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several kings of Parthia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:5:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41, 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phradmon: <entryFree id="n36151" type="main" key="Phradmon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phradmon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated statuary of Argos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phragandae: <entryFree id="n36152" type="main" key="Phragandae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phragandae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phragmites: <entryFree id="n36153" type="greek" key="phragmi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phragmītes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fragmi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n36153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of reed growing in hedges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 52, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phrahates: <entryFree id="n36154" type="main" key="Phra^ha_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrăhātes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. Phraates.</entryFree>
phrasis: <entryFree id="n36155" type="greek" key="phra^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fra/sis</foreign>, in rhetoric, <sense id="n36155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diction</hi> (pure Lat. elocutio; <cit><quote lang="la">post-Aug.): (in Albucio) non lexis magna, sed phrasis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3</bibl></cit> prooem.; <case>acc.</case> phrasin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 87</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 1, 1</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
phrenesis: <entryFree id="n36156" type="greek" key="phre^ne_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrĕnēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fre/nhsis</foreign>, <sense id="n36156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">madness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delirium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frenzy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phrenesis tum demum est, cum continua dementia esse incipit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit> (al. phrenitis; shortly before written as Greek, <foreign lang="greek">fre/nhsis</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">die et phrenesin et insaniam viribus necessariam, Sen. de Ira, 1, 13, 3: manifesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:136" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 7, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phreneticus: <entryFree id="n36157" type="greek" key="phre^ne_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrĕnētĭcus</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">phrĕnīt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">frenhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delirious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frantic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:38:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 38, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex phreneticis alii hilares, alii tristes sunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit> (al. phreniticis); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 28</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of the winds, which rage, as it were, in a frantic manner, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 46, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phrenion: <entryFree id="n36158" type="main" key="phre^ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrĕnĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, i. q. anemone, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 23, 94, § 164</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phreniticus: <entryFree id="n36159" type="main" key="phre^ni_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrĕnītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. phreneticus.</entryFree>
phrenitis: <entryFree id="n36160" type="main" key="phre^ni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrĕnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. phrenesis.</entryFree>
phrenitizo: <entryFree id="n36161" type="greek" key="phre^ni_ti_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrĕnītīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">frenitizw</foreign>, <sense id="n36161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be mad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crazy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frantic</hi>, Cael. Aur. Acut. praef.</sense></entryFree>
phrixus: <entryFree id="n36162" type="main" key="Phrixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrixus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, erroneously written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phryxus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fri/cos</foreign>, <sense id="n36162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Athamas and Nephele</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Helle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with whom he fled to Colchis on a ram with a golden fleece; he there sacrificed the ram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and hung up its golden fleece in the grove of Ares</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whence it was afterwards brought back to Greece by Jason and the Argonauts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 2" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:3" default="NO">3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:14" default="NO">14</bibl>; 21; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 175</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrixi litora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the shores of the Hellespont</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also, semita Phrixi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portitor Phrixi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the constellation Aries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:155" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 155</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Com.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem facere arietem Phrixi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to strip of money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n36162.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrixēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Phryx-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n36162.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phrixus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phrixean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellera,</quote> <trans><tr>the golden fleece</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:368" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 368</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrixeae stagna sororis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Hellespont</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:278" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 278</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also, pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 56</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 776" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:542" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrixei Colchi,</quote> <trans><tr>where Phrixus was hospitably received</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:391" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a ram</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:211" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnus,</quote> <trans><tr>the constellation Aries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:51:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 51, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36162.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ægean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrixeum mare,</quote> <trans><tr>the Ægean Sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 564" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 564</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n36162.4" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrixĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Phryx-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Phrixian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">made of superior wool</hi>: toga, Plin. <cb n="PHRY" /> 8, 48, 74, § 195.—<hi rend="ital">Subst. piur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrixĭā-nae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">clothing made of superior wool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phronesis: <entryFree id="n36163" type="greek" key="phro^ne_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrŏnēsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fro/nhsis</foreign>, <sense id="n36163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prudence;</hi> personified as <hi rend="ital">the mother of philology</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phryganion: <entryFree id="n36164" type="main" key="phryga^ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrygănĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an animal</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 50, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phryges: <entryFree id="n36165" type="main" key="Phry^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phryges</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fru/ges</foreign>, <sense id="n36165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Phrygians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noted among the ancients for their indolence and stupidity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and also for their skill in embroidering in gold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 196</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 41, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 33</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phryx Aesopus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Phrygian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl></cit> prooem. 52.—In partic., of <hi rend="ital">Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:274" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 274</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Marsyas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:709" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 709</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">a priest of Cybele</hi> (v. Gallus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 22</bibl> (3, 15), 16; <cit><quote lang="la">and with a contemptuous allusion, semivir Phryx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 99</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: sero sapiunt Phryges (alluding to the obstinate refusal of the Trojans to deliver up Helen), Liv. Andron. or Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=342" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 342</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 199 Rib.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum igitur nostrum est an vestrum hoc proverbium, Phrygem plagis fieri solere meliorem?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36165.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Romans</hi> (as descendants from Æneas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:106" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 106</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36165.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrygĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*frugi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the country of Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided into Phrygia Major and Phrygia Minor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 41, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:1:5" default="NO">2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:11:12" default="NO">2, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36165.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Troy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygiae fatum componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:12:63" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 12, 63</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36165.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrygĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (various read. for Phrixianus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36165.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">phrygĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an embroiderer in gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an embroiderer</hi> (because the Phrygians were remarkably skilful in this art), Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 3, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">phrygio, qui pulvinar poterat pingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat fullo, phrygio, aurifex, lanarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36165.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">phrygĭōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">embroidered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 196</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36165.7" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrygiscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phrygian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36165.8" n="F" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrygĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fru/gios</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n36165.9" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Phrygian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulneratus ferro Phrygio,</quote> <trans><tr>of Sylla's Phrygian slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:32:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pelops</tr>, <tr>the son of Tantalus</tr>, <tr>king of Phrygia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <trans><tr>of Phrygian marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 41</bibl></cit>; also, for <hi rend="ital">yellow ochre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 36, § 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <trans><tr>embroidered garments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <trans><tr>Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <trans><tr>who draw her chariot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">buxum,</quote> <trans><tr>the Phrygian flute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lotos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:258" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes,</quote> <trans><tr>cymbals</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modi,</quote> <trans><tr>a vehement</tr>, <tr>stirring</tr>, <tr>passionate kind of music</tr>, <tr>which was used at the festivals of Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:456" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 456</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 64</bibl> (70); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18</bibl> (3, 15), 15: <cit><quote lang="la">mos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:115" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:84:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 84, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36165.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, because Troy belonged to Phrygia, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Troy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inuri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hymenaei,</quote> <trans><tr>between Æneas and Lavinia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 358</bibl></cit>; also, for <hi rend="ital">Æneas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva,</quote> <trans><tr>the statue of Pallas in Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Antenor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Helenus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Paris</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Æneas</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 75</bibl></cit>; also, for <hi rend="ital">Laomedon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minister,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ganymede</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:417" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 417</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called, also, venator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:1:548" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 1, 548</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstra,</quote> <trans><tr>the seamonster sent by Neptune against Hesione</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:512" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magister,</quote> <trans><tr>Palinurus</tr>, <tr>Æneas's pilot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9</bibl></cit>. 44: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem Idaeam e Phrygiis sedibus excipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrygĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Phrygian women</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o verae Phrygiae neque enim Phryges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 617</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 518</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36165.11" n="3" level="3"> Phrygius amnis, v. 1. Phryx.—</sense><sense id="n36165.12" n="G" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phryx</orth>, <itype>ygis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phrygian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:585" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 585</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36165.13" n="H" level="1"> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrygĭcus</orth>, a false read. for Phrygius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 5, 2</bibl>; v. F. 2. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> supra).</sense></entryFree>
phryne: <entryFree id="n36166" type="main" key="Phry_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phrȳnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fru/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n36166.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated hetœra in Athens</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so wealthy that she offered to rebuild the city of Thebes after it had been destroyed by Alexander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quae deletas potuit componere Thebas Phryne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 9</bibl>; Val. Max. <pb n="1373" /> <cb n="PHYC" /> 4, 3, ext. 3.—</sense><sense id="n36166.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman courtesan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:14:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 14, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36166.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A procuress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phrynion: <entryFree id="n36167" type="greek" key="phry_ni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrȳnĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fru/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n36167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> poterion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 97, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:123" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 10, 76, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phrynos: <entryFree id="n36168" type="main" key="phry_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phrȳnos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fru=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n36168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of venomous frog</hi>, <hi rend="ital">living in thorn-hedges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 5, 19, § 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
