phryx: <entryFree id="n36169" type="main" key="Phryx1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phryx</orth>, <itype>Phrygis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fru/c</foreign>, <sense id="n36169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rising in Lydia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and falling into the Hermus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">otherwise called</hi> Hyllus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 119</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">oftener, Phrygius amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:37:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 37, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 38, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 119</bibl>; Strab. 13, 4, 5.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36170" type="main" key="Phryx2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phryx</orth>, <itype>Phrygis</itype>, v. Phryges <sense id="n36170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> and G.</sense></entryFree>
phryxeus: <entryFree id="n36171" type="main" key="Phryxe_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phryxēus</orth>, v. Phrixus, II.</entryFree>
phryxianus: <entryFree id="n36172" type="main" key="Phryxi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phryxĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Phrixus <sense id="n36172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
phryxonides: <entryFree id="n36173" type="main" key="Phryxo^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phryxŏnĭdes nymphae</orth>, <sense id="n36173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fabled rearers of the first bees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phryxus: <entryFree id="n36174" type="main" key="Phryxus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phryxus</orth>, v. Phrixus <sense id="n36174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
phthas: <entryFree id="n36175" type="main" key="Phthas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phthas</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fqa/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Egyplian Vulcan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundus Vulcanus Nilo natus, Phthas, ut Aegyptii appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phthia: <entryFree id="n36176" type="main" key="Phthi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phthīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fqi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Thessaliotis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of Achilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 284</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36176.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phthīas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Phthian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 165</bibl> (al. Phthia).—</sense><sense id="n36176.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phthīōta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phthī-ōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fqiw/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Phthiote</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 21</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">the Phthiotes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 14, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36176.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phthīōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fqiw=tis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Phthiotis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a district of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which Phthia lay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36176.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phthī-ōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fqiwtiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Phthiotis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phthiotian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Thessalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tempe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36176.5" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phthīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phthia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 38</bibl></cit> (2, 5, 22); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Achilles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Peleus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 17, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phthir: <entryFree id="n36177" type="main" key="phthi_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phthīr</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fqei/r</foreign>, <sense id="n36177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">louse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sea-parasite</hi> (pure Lat. pediculus marinus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phthiriasis: <entryFree id="n36178" type="greek" key="phthi_ri^a^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phthīrĭăsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fqeiri/asis</foreign>, <sense id="n36178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lousy disease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phthiriasis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 13, 86, § 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 6, 23, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:61 al" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 25, § 61 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
phthirophagi: <entryFree id="n36179" type="main" key="Phthi_ro^pha^gi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phthīrŏphăgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fqeirofa/goi</foreign> (lice-eaters), <sense id="n36179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Sarmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phthirophoros: <entryFree id="n36180" type="greek" key="phthi_ro^pho^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phthīrŏphŏros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fqeirofo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n36180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pine-tree that bears very small cones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phthisicus: <entryFree id="n36181" type="greek" key="phthi^si^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phthĭsĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fqisiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consumptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phthisical</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 6, 21, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 16, 19, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:230" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 17, 67, § 230</bibl>; Vitr, 2, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 186" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 186</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:21:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 21, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phthisis: <entryFree id="n36182" type="main" key="phthi^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phthĭsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fqi/sis</foreign>, <sense id="n36182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phthisis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vera phthisis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:75:10" default="NO">75, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 21, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:62" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 6, 33, § 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:95" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phthisisco:
<entryFree id="n36183" type="main" key="phthi^sisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phthĭsisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n36183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [phthisis], <hi rend="ital">to become consumptive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">phthisical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phthisiscentibus medicabilis piscina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 14</bibl></cit>.
(† <orth extent="full" lang="la">phthitărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, a false read. for phthir (q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>
phthius: <entryFree id="n36184" type="main" key="Phthi_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phthīus</orth>, v. Phthia, E.</entryFree>
phthongus: <entryFree id="n36185" type="greek" key="phthongus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phthongus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fqo/ggos</foreign>, <sense id="n36185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnum dicebat Dorico moveri phthongo, Jovem Phrygio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 22, 20, § 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 939</bibl> (pure Lat. sonus).</sense></entryFree>
phthorius: <entryFree id="n36186" type="greek" key="phtho^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phthŏrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fqo/rios</foreign>, <sense id="n36186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corrupting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vinum phthorium vocant, quoniam facit abortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phu: <entryFree id="n36187" type="main" key="phu_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phū</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">phun</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">fou=</foreign>, <sense id="n36187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of valerian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 176" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:177" default="NO">177</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36188" type="main" key="phu2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phu</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">fu</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, <sense id="n36188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foh! fugh!</hi> phu in malam crucem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 5</bibl> (Ritschl, fu); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 213</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1024</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
phulacista: <entryFree id="n36189" type="main" key="phu^la^cista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phŭlăcista</orth>, v. phylacista.</entryFree>
phy: <entryFree id="n36190" type="main" key="phy"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phy</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, <sense id="n36190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pish! tush!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 58</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1024</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
phyaces: <entryFree id="n36191" type="main" key="Phy^a_ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phyāces</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Getœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vincet saevum Cyclops feritate Phyacen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phycis: <entryFree id="n36192" type="greek" key="phy_cis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phȳcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fuki/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish that lives among sea-weed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and changes its color at various seasons of the year</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the lamprey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 26, 42, § 81</bibl>. <cb n="PHYS" /></sense></entryFree>
phycitis: <entryFree id="n36193" type="greek" key="phy_ci_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phȳcītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fuki=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n36193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phycos: <entryFree id="n36194" type="greek" key="phy_cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phȳcos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fu=kos</foreign>, <sense id="n36194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sea-weed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seawrack</hi>, = fucus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 48, § 135</bibl>: phycos thalassion, <hi rend="ital">rock-moss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orchil</hi> (pure Lat. fucus marinus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 10, 66, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phycus: <entryFree id="n36195" type="main" key="Phy_cu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phȳcūs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fukou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n36195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory in Cyrene</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Ras-Sem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ElRazat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phylaca: <entryFree id="n36196" type="greek" key="phy^la^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phylăca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fulakh/</foreign>, <sense id="n36196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prison</hi> (pure Lat. custodia): <cit><quote lang="la">abductus in phylacam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phylace: <entryFree id="n36197" type="main" key="Phy^la^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phylăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fulakh/</foreign>. <sense id="n36197.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Protesilaus reigned;</hi> its ruins are near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Ghidek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36197.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phylăcēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phylacian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres Phylaceides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 35</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phylăcēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<case>acc.</case> Phylaceida), <hi rend="ital">Laodamia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Protesilaus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:273" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 273</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36197.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phy-lăcēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Phylacian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Laodamia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:14:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 14, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36197.3" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phylăcaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Phylacians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36197.4" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Phȳ^lăcĭ-des</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Phyll-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Phylacides</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Protesilaus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 356</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">respice Phylaciden,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:19:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 19, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36197.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of the Molossians in Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phylacista: <entryFree id="n36198" type="main" key="phy^la^cista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phylăcista</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">phŭlă-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fulakisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jailer;</hi> hence, comic. transf., <hi rend="ital">of a creditor who duns for his money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and makes a prisoner of the debtor by keeping a watch on his house</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phylacterium: <entryFree id="n36199" type="greek" key="phy^lacte_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phylactērĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">fyl-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fulakth/rion</foreign>. <sense id="n36199.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an amulet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem oculorum ut non patiaris ... de tribus cerasis lapillos pertundes et lino inserto pro phylacterio uteris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36199.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n36199.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Slips of parchment worn by the Jews on the forehead and the left arm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phylacteries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 23, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 4, 23, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36199.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Chains and medals worn by gladiators around their necks as tokens of victory</hi>, Vet. Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:68" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phylarchus: <entryFree id="n36200" type="greek" key="phy^larchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phylarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fu/larxos</foreign>, <sense id="n36200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief of a tribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a prince</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phylarchus Arabum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saracenorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2</bibl></cit>; Sex. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phyle: <entryFree id="n36201" type="main" key="Phy_le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phȳlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fulh/</foreign>, <sense id="n36201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a castle in Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:9:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phyllacides: <entryFree id="n36202" type="main" key="Phylla^ci^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phyllăcĭdes</orth>, i. q. Phylacides, under Phylace.</entryFree>
phyllanthes: <entryFree id="n36203" type="greek" key="phyllanthes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phyllanthes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fullanqe/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant with prickly leaves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 59, § 99</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phylleis: <entryFree id="n36204" type="main" key="Phylle_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phyllēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <sense id="n36204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fullhi/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from the city of Phyllus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Thessaly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres Phylleides,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thessalian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
phylleius: <entryFree id="n36205" type="main" key="Phylle_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phyllēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fullh/i+os</foreign>, <sense id="n36205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Phyllus in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Phylleian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cœneus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 479</bibl></cit>: mater, perh. <hi rend="ital">Laodamia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 783</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phyllis: <entryFree id="n36206" type="main" key="Phyllis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phyllis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis and ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fulli/s</foreign>. <sense id="n36206.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of King Sithon of Thrace; she was changed into an almond-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 59:243" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 59, 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 45, § 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:34" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36206.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an almond-tree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 149</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n36206.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phyllius: <entryFree id="n36207" type="main" key="Phylli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phyllĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Bœotian who was in love with Cygnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 372</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phyllodoce: <entryFree id="n36208" type="main" key="Phyllo^do^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phyllŏdŏcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Nereus and Doris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 336</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 17</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
phyllon: <entryFree id="n36209" type="greek" key="phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fu/llon</foreign>, <sense id="n36209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> leucacantha, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 16, 18, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phyllos: <entryFree id="n36210" type="main" key="Phyllos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Phyllos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phyma: <entryFree id="n36211" type="greek" key="phy_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phȳma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fu=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n36211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of boil</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18:23" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 18, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes">33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phynon: <entryFree id="n36212" type="main" key="phynon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phynon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eye-salve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phyrama: <entryFree id="n36213" type="greek" key="phy_ra_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phȳrāma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fu/rama</foreign>, <sense id="n36213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gum of the tree called</hi> metops, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 23, 49, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
physcon: <entryFree id="n36214" type="main" key="Physcon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Physcon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*fu/skwn</foreign> (Pot-belly, Fat-paunch), <sense id="n36214.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Ptolemy Euergetes II. of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
physema: <entryFree id="n36215" type="greek" key="phy_se_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phȳsēma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fu/shma</foreign> (a bladder;<cb n="PIAC" />  hence), <sense id="n36215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hollow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty pearl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
physeter: <entryFree id="n36216" type="main" key="phy_se_ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phȳsēter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fushth/r</foreign>. <sense id="n36216.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A blow-pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blowing-tube</hi>, Pelag. Vet. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n36216.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a large species of whale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cachalot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spermaceti whale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 4, 3, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1030" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1030</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
physica: <entryFree id="n36217" type="main" key="phy^si^ca1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fusikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n36217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">natural science</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nutural philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">physics</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 21, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 22, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n36218" type="main" key="phy^si^ca2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. physicus, II. B.</entryFree>
physice: <entryFree id="n36219" type="main" key="phy^si^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. physicus <sense id="n36219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
physicus: <entryFree id="n36220" type="greek" key="phy^si^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭcus</orth> (scanned phȳsĭcus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 101</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fusiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to natural philosophy</hi> or <hi rend="ital">physics</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural</hi>, <hi rend="ital">physical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quiddam physicum,</quote> <trans><tr>something relating to physics</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:21:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <trans><tr>naturalists</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> Carm. Med. 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36220.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n36220.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a natural philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">naturalist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ait physicus Anaxagoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Democritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non pudet igitur physicum, id est speculatorem venatoremque naturae, petere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 3, 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36220.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">physics</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">physicorum ignarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in physicis alienus,</quote> <trans><tr>not versed in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of naturalists</hi>, <hi rend="ital">physically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:7:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
physiognomon: <entryFree id="n36221" type="greek" key="phy^si^ogno_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭognōmon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fusiognw/mwn</foreign> (a knower of nature; hence, one who knows a person's character from his features), <sense id="n36221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a physiognomist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zopyrus physiognomon, qui se profitebatur hominum mores naturasque ex corpore, oculis, vultu, fronte pernoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">naturam cujusque ex formā perspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
physiologia: <entryFree id="n36222" type="greek" key="phy^si^o^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fusiologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n36222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knowledge of nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">natural philosophy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">physiology</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae ratio, quam physiologiam Graeci appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:41:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 41, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
physiologice: <entryFree id="n36223" type="main" key="phy^si^o^lo^gi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭŏlŏgĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. physiologicus <sense id="n36223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
physiologicus: <entryFree id="n36224" type="greek" key="phy^si^o^lo^gi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭŏlŏgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fusiologiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to physiology</hi>, <hi rend="ital">physiological</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 8, 1.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭŏlŏgĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">naturally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">physiologically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
physiologus: <entryFree id="n36225" type="greek" key="phy^si^o^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">fusio/logos</foreign>, <sense id="n36225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to physiology</hi>, <hi rend="ital">physiological;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">physĭŏlŏga</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Physiology</hi>, a work by Juba, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
physis: <entryFree id="n36226" type="main" key="phy^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">physis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fu/sis</foreign>, <sense id="n36226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nature.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36226.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: seu cupis genitor vocari et auctor orbis aut physis ipsa Panque, Poët. in Anth. Lat. t. 2, p. 474 Burm.—</sense><sense id="n36226.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">partycolored precious stones which had no distinctive name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freaks of nature</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 195</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
phyteuma: <entryFree id="n36227" type="greek" key="phy^teuma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">phyteuma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">fu/teuma</foreign>, <sense id="n36227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">groundsel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 99, § 125</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piabilis: <entryFree id="n36228" type="hapax" key="pi^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pio</etym>, <sense id="n36228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be expiated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piabile fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:289" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 289</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
piacularis: <entryFree id="n36229" type="main" key="pi^a_cu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭācŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>piaculum</etym>, <sense id="n36229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">atoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expiatory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piacular</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): hostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=30" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 30</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificia,</quote> <trans><tr>sinofferings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut piacularia Junoni fierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 3</bibl></cit>: piacularia auspicia appellabant, quae sacrificantibus tristia portendebant, cum aut hostia ab arā effugisset, aut percussa mugitum dedisset, aut in aliam partem corporis quam oporteret cecidisset, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=244" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 244</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">piacularis porta appellatur propter aliqua piacula, quae ibidem fiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=212" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 212</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 9</bibl>.—Comic., transf., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 36</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭācŭlārĭ-ter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">sinfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">negare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 22</bibl></cit> (al. peculiariter).</sense></entryFree>
piaculo: <entryFree id="n36230" type="main" key="pi^a_cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭācŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to appease</hi> or <hi rend="ital">propitiate with an offering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars Pater, te hisce suovetaurilibus piaculo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
piaculum: <entryFree id="n36231" type="main" key="pi^a_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭācŭlum</orth> (sync. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭā-clum</orth>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 14, 219), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pio</etym>, <sense id="n36231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of appeasing a deity;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n36231.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36231.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sin-offering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitiatory sacrifiee</hi>:<pb n="1374" /> <cb n="PICE" />  porco piaculo facito, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 139</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcc femina piaculum pati,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piaculum hostia caedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te piacula nulla resolvent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piacula manibus infert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsi mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: sed quo te, M. Tulli, piaculo taceam, i. e. <hi rend="ital">how can I be justified in</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 31, 31, § 116</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 10, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36231.3" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">an animal offered up in sacrifice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a victim</hi>: duc nigras pecudes; <cit><quote lang="la">ea prima piacula sunto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sperat tragicae furtiva piacula cervae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>substitution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 120</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, </sense><sense id="n36231.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Of persons offered as <hi rend="ital">an expiation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atonement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hannibalem) ad piaculum rupti foederis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut luendis periculis publicis piacula simus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 28, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36231.5" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a remedy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36231.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Punishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dea a violatoribus (sui templi) gravia piacula exegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:14" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:702" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 702</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36231.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which requires expiation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36231.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A wicked action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crime; guilt</hi>: eo die verberari piaculum est, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">palam mutire plebeio piaculum est, Enn. ap. Fest. s. v. mutire, p. 145 Müll. (Trag. v. 376 Vahl.): piaculum est misereri nos hominum rem male gerentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine piaculo rerum praetermissarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piaculum committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 21, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissa piacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 569</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solutus piaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sine piaculo quodam sanctissimas necessitudines scindi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:37" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne terra impleatur piaculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:19:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 19, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36231.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An unhappy event</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a misfortune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 46, § 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piamen: <entryFree id="n36232" type="hapax" key="pi^a_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pio</etym>, <sense id="n36232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of expiation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an atonement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Februa Romani dixere piamina patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
piamentum: <entryFree id="n36233" type="main" key="pi^a_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of expiation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an atoning sacrifice</hi> (perh. not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 59, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 4, 11, § 30</bibl>; cf.: piamenta, quibus utitur (in) expiando, Fest. s. v. piatrix, p. 213 Müll.; p. 238 ib.—</sense><sense id="n36233.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 2, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piatio: <entryFree id="n36234" type="main" key="pi^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appeasing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">propitiating of the gods by offerings</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 5, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piatrix: <entryFree id="n36235" type="main" key="pi^a_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>piator</etym>, <sense id="n36235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that appeases the gods by a sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piatrix dicebatur sacerdos, quae expiare erat solita, quam quidam simulatricem, alii sagam, alii expiatricem vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=213" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 213</bibl></cit> Müll. (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 101</bibl>, read plicatricem).</sense></entryFree>
pica: <entryFree id="n36236" type="main" key="pi_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prob. from pingo, the variegated, spotted bird</etym>, <sense id="n36236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magpie</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:118" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 42, 59, § 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:294 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 294 sq.</bibl>; Pers. prol. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
picanus: <entryFree id="n36237" type="main" key="Pi_^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pī^cānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in the territory of the Picentines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:304" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 304</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 500</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
picaria: <entryFree id="n36238" type="main" key="pi^ca_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pix</etym>, <sense id="n36238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where pitch is made</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pitch-hut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:22:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 22, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal picariarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
picatus: <entryFree id="n36239" type="main" key="pi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pico.</entryFree>
picati: <entryFree id="n36240" type="gloss" key="pi^ca_ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭcāti</orth> <itype>appellantur quidam</itype>, quorum pedes formati sunt in speciem sphingum: quod eas Dori ficas vocant, Fest. p 206 Müll.</entryFree>
picea: <entryFree id="n36241" type="main" key="pi^ce^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭcĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pix</etym>, <sense id="n36241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pitch-pine</hi>: Pinus silvestris, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 257</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 18, § 40</bibl> sqq.; 16, 24, 38, § 90.</sense></entryFree>
piceatus: <entryFree id="n36242" type="main" key="pi^ce^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭcĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bedaubed with pitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitchy;</hi> hence, of hands to which others' property seems to stick, <hi rend="ital">thievish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:59:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 59, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
picens: <entryFree id="n36243" type="main" key="Pi_cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. Picenum, A.</entryFree>
picentia: <entryFree id="n36244" type="main" key="Pi_centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south-east of Salernum</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Vicenza</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:579" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 579</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n36244.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīcentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Picentia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Picentian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
picentinus: <entryFree id="n36245" type="main" key="Pi_centi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīcentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Picentia, II., and Picenum, C.</entryFree>
picenum: <entryFree id="n36246" type="main" key="Pi_ce_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīcēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>acc. to Fest. from picus: Picena regio in quā est Asculum, dicta, quod, Sabini cum Asculum proficiscerentur, in vexillo eorum picus consederit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=212" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 212</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n36246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in the eastern part of Italy which produced fruits and oil of excellent quality</hi>, the territory of the mod. <hi rend="ital">Ancona</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:50:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 50, 2</bibl>; Mel. <cb n="PICT" /> 2, 4, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:43 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 43 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36246.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Picenum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Picene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Acilius Palicanus, Picens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīcentes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Picenum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Picenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 8, 25</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Picentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 110</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Picentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:313" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 313</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Picens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36246.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pī-cēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Picene</hi> (only of things; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas Picens is used both of persons and things): ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 27, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 3, 4, § 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:52:11" default="NO">11, 52, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:36:1" default="NO">13, 36, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:74 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 74 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n36246.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīcentīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, lit., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Picentes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Picentian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Picene</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:47:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 47, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
piceus: <entryFree id="n36247" type="main" key="pi^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pix</etym>. <sense id="n36247.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of pitch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36247.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">black as pitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitch-black</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piceā crassus caligine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbine fumans piceo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:507" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:439" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:41:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 41, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber piceus crassusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 33, 61, § 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coacti aëris caligo picea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 7, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
picinus: <entryFree id="n36248" type="main" key="pi^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pitch-black</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pico: <entryFree id="n36249" type="main" key="pi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bedaub with pitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pitch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tar.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36249.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia picata, lacus, vinarius picatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 48, § 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 7, 6, § 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36249.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to season with pitch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 23</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pitchy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum picatum,</quote> <trans><tr>wine that has naturally a pitchy taste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 24, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:26" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 2, 4, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:107" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
picra: <entryFree id="n36250" type="main" key="picra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">picra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, prob. <sense id="n36250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicine made of aloes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">picrae solutio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
picridiae: <entryFree id="n36251" type="main" key="picri^di^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">picrĭdĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bitter salad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. ad Catechum. de Cataclysm. 4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. ad Catechum. de Cataclysm. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
picris: <entryFree id="n36252" type="greek" key="picris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">picris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pikri/s</foreign>. <sense id="n36252.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Bitter lettuce</hi>, a kind of salad (in Greek letters, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 38, § 126</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n36252.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant that blooms all the year round</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 17, 65, § 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pictacium: <entryFree id="n36253" type="main" key="picta^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pictăcĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, i. q. pittacium, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 9</bibl>; v. pittacium.</entryFree>
pictavi: <entryFree id="n36254" type="main" key="Picta_vi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pictāvi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a later appellation of the</hi> Pictones, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 21</bibl>; Ven. Carm. 6, 7, 215; 2, 19, 2.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36254.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pictāva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the capital of the Pictavi</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Poictiers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Vit. S. Mart. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36254.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pic-tāvĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pictavian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 51, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
picti: <entryFree id="n36255" type="main" key="Picti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Picti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pingo, the painted people</etym>, <sense id="n36255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Britain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Picts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ancient Caledonians</hi> (so named from their practice of tattooing themselves), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 254</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pictilis: <entryFree id="n36256" type="main" key="picti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pictĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pictus</etym>, <sense id="n36256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">embroidered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">balteus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pictones: <entryFree id="n36257" type="main" key="Picto^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pictŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Aquitanian Gaul</hi>, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Pays de Poiteau</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:26" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:27" default="NO">27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 436</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n36257.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pictŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pictonic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pictonicum litus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 9, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pictor: <entryFree id="n36258" type="main" key="pictor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pingo</etym>. <sense id="n36258.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A painter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 13, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:53 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 53 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:76" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:28" default="NO">12, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36258.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an embroiderer</hi>, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:280" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 280</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36259" type="main" key="Pictor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Fabia. </sense><sense id="n36259.1" n="A" level="2"> C. Fabius Pictor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36259.2" n="B" level="2"> Q. Fabius Pictor, <hi rend="ital">an ancient Roman historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pictorius: <entryFree id="n36260" type="main" key="picto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pictōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. pictor</etym>, <sense id="n36260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to painters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pictorial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1:23" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pictura: <entryFree id="n36261" type="main" key="pictu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pictūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pingo</etym>, <sense id="n36261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the art of painting.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36261.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">una est ars ratioque picturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mund. p. 66, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36261.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a painting of the face</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 105</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36261.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a painting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">picture</hi> (cf. tabula): <cit><quote lang="la">et si qua inutilis pictura sit, eam vendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 11, 36</bibl>: nego ullam picturam neque in tabulis neque textilem fuisse, quin conquisierit,<cb n="PIET" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedant statuae et picturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 16:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">positae sunt picturae Herculis liberos occidentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:34:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 5, 34, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas et picturas avehere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicitur tabulam picturae cedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:78" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 78</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">embroideries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">textilibus picturis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">paintings in Mosaic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 64</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a carving in relief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sculpsit in eis picturam cherubim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 6, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36261.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a painting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">picture</hi> in words: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ab istā picturā imaginibusque virtutum traducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: Homerum tradunt caecum fuisse; <cit><quote lang="la">at ejus picturam, non poësin videmus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 39, 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
picturatus: <entryFree id="n36262" type="main" key="pictu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pictūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pictura</etym>, <sense id="n36262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pictured</hi>, i. e. </sense><sense id="n36262.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Party-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">variegated</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">agger floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:58" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Ep. ad Ser. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36262.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Embroidered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:483" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 483</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pictus: <entryFree id="n36263" type="main" key="pictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from pingo.</entryFree>
picula: <entryFree id="n36264" type="main" key="pi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pix</etym>, <sense id="n36264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pitch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
picumnus: <entryFree id="n36265" type="main" key="Pi_cumnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīcumnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīlumnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two brother deities of the Romans; the first a personification of the woodpecker</hi> (picus), <hi rend="ital">and the second a personification of the pestle</hi> (pilum); <hi rend="ital">both were companions of Mars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and tutelary deities of married people and little children</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 528, 11 sq.</bibl>; id. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 6, 9; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 4, 11, 5</bibl>; Aem. Mac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 518, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 76</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pilumnus was the son of Daunus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">husband of Danaë and ancestor of Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
picus: <entryFree id="n36266" type="main" key="pi_cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. root pingo; cf. pica</etym>. <sense id="n36266.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A woodpecker</hi>, one of the birds used in augury, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt et parvae aves uncorum unguium, ut pici, Martio cognomine insignes et in auspicatu magni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 18, 20, § 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:122" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 44, § 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 518, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36266.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fabulous bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the griffin</hi>: picos veteres esse voluerunt, quos Graeci <foreign lang="greek">gru/pas</foreign> appellant. Plautus Aulularia (4, 8, 1): <cit><quote lang="la">pici divitiis, qui aureos montes colunt, Ego solus supero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 7 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36267" type="main" key="Pi_cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Saturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandfather of Latinus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of the aborigines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a prophet; he was changed by Circe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose love he had slighted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">into a woodpecker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 320</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 189</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pie: <entryFree id="n36268" type="main" key="pi^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. pius <sense id="n36268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
piens: <entryFree id="n36269" type="main" key="pi^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. pius.</entryFree>
pieria: <entryFree id="n36270" type="main" key="Pi_e^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pieri/a</foreign>. <sense id="n36270.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A country of Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south of the Haliacmon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 26</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n36270.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīĕrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pierian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36270.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A country of Syria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Cilicia and Phœnicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a mountain of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the capital city</hi> Seleucia Pieria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 21, 18, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
