pieros: <entryFree id="n36271" type="main" key="Pi_e^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīĕros</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pi/eros</foreign>. <sense id="n36271.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">King of Emathia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who gave to his daughters the names of the nine Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 302</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36271.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Macedonian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of the nine Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:10" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 10</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n36271.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīĕris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis or ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Pierus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Muse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:222" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 222</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīĕrĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:36" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36271.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pierian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Thessalian; sacred to the Muses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <trans><tr>from Mount Pierus</tr>, <tr>in Thessaly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit> (3, 4), 5: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl></cit> prol. 17: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vir Pieriā pellice saucius,</quote> <trans><tr>Thessalian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:62" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:58" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>dedicated to the Muses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:23" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuba,</quote> <trans><tr>an heroic poem</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:64:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 64, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <trans><tr>poet's brow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:70:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 70, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <trans><tr>laurel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:52:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex,</quote> <trans><tr>the Muses and poets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst. plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīĕrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:21:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pietas: <entryFree id="n36272" type="main" key="pi^e^tas1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pius</etym>, <sense id="n36272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dutiful conduct</hi> towards the gods, one's parents, relatives, benefactors, country, etc., <hi rend="ital">sense of duty.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36272.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36272.2" n="A" level="2"> With respect to the gods, <hi rend="ital">piety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim pietas justitia adversus deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:41:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 41, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 3</bibl>; cf.: aequitas tripartita dicitur esse; <cit><quote lang="la">una ad superos deos, altera ad manes, tertia ad homines pertinere. Prima pietas, secunda sanctitas, tertia justitia aut aequitas nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:23:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 23, 90</bibl></cit>: pietas adversus deos, id. <pb n="1375" /> <cb n="PIGE" /> Fin. 3, 22, 73: <cit><quote lang="la">deos placatos pietas efficiet et sanctitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex fretus pietate deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:B. Punic. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> B. Punic. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 160, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 369 Vahl.): nec pietas ulla est, velatum saepe videri Vortier ad lapidem atque omnes accedere ad aras, etc., <hi rend="ital">that is not piety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to incline with veiled head to the marble</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1198</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36272.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Conscientiousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrupulousness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:607" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 607</bibl>.—So of <hi rend="ital">love and duty towards God</hi> (eccl. Lat.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl> Pet. 1, 6.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl> Pet. 3, 11.—</sense><sense id="n36272.4" n="B" level="2"> With respect to one's parents, children, relatives, country, benefactors, etc., <hi rend="ital">duty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dutifulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loyalty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patriotism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gratitude</hi>, etc.: <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Salve, mi pater insperate. <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Volup est, quom istuc ex pietate vestrā nobis contigit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem tuom si percoles per pietatem,</quote> <trans><tr>dutifully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia erga deos religio, erga parentes pietas nominatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est pietas, nisi voluntas grata in parentes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiam cole et pietatem, quae cum sit magna in parentibus et propinquis, tum in patriā maxima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:15:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas, quae erga patriam aut parentes, aut alios sanguine conjunctos officium conservare monet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:22:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 22, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 13, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas in matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mi mater, tua pietas plane nobis auxilio fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 122</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">v. 99: felix nati pietate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solemnia pietatis,</quote> <trans><tr>the last offices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregium narras mirā pietate parentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietas erga aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tui omnes valent summāque pietate te desiderant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec publicae pietatis intererat, quid vocarere,</quote> <trans><tr>to the affection of the citizens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:21:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 499</bibl></cit>.—Towards a husband (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque id (officium nostrum) magis facimus quam nos monet pietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus est pietas in conjuge Tereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 635</bibl></cit>.—The formula PIETATIS CAVSA or EX PIETATE (opp. EX TESTAMENTO), in epitaphs, denotes that the heir raised the monument to the deceased, not because compelled by the latter's last will, but out of affection and respect, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4692</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 710</bibl>, n. 314.—</sense><sense id="n36272.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose). </sense><sense id="n36272.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Justice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tibi ... pro talibus ausis Di, si qua est caelo pietas, quae talia curet, Persolvant grates dignas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 536</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:410" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 410</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 688</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa deum pietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36272.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gentleness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenderness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compassion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">permittite Patres Conscripti a pietate vestrā impetrari, ut damnatis liberum mortis arbitrium indulgeatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:79:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 79, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:9:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 9, 5</bibl>.—In addressing a person: <cit><quote lang="la">mea pietas,</quote> <trans><tr>my kind friend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36272.8" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>personified</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Piety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who had two temples at Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 34, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 43, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 36, 36, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=209" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 209</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1824 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3291</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36273" type="main" key="Pi^e^tas2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n36273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Atti, p. 329.—</sense><sense id="n36273.1" n="II" level="1"> Also, <hi rend="ital">the name of a ship</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3608</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36273.2" n="III" level="1"> Pietas Julia, <hi rend="ital">a Roman colony in Istria</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Pola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pietaticultrix: <entryFree id="n36274" type="main" key="pi^e^ta_ti^cultrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭĕtātĭcultrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pietas-cultrix</etym>, <sense id="n36274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that practises maternal care</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciconia pietaticultrix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pigeo: <entryFree id="n36275" type="main" key="pi^ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭgĕo</orth>, <itype>gŭi, and pĭgĭtum est, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root pik-, to be angry; cf.: peccare, pejor (for pec-ior), pessimus (contr. from pējessimus); Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pikro/s</foreign>, bitter</etym>, <sense id="n36275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to feel annoyance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reluctance at; to repent of</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n36275.1" n="I" level="1"> As a <hi rend="ital">verb. pers.</hi> (very rare): pudet quod turpe est; piget quod dolet, Donat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscis ab invitā verba pigenda lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:1:74" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36275.2" n="II" level="1"> Piget, piguit, or pigitum est, <hi rend="ital">third pers. sing. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it irks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troubles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">displeases</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chagrins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afflicts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grieves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgusts</hi> one; <hi rend="ital">I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc.), <hi rend="ital">dislike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathe</hi>, etc.; with <hi rend="ital">acc. of the person</hi> and <hi rend="ital">gen. of the thing;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.;</hi> with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.;</hi> with two <hi rend="ital">acc.; absol.</hi>, etc. (cf. taedet).—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: mea mater, tui me miseret, mei piget, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl> (Trag. v. 82): dolet pudetque Graium me et vero piget, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 424, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortari pudet, non prodesse id piget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 424, 4</bibl></cit>: pudet pigetque mei me, <cb n="PIGM" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Turp. 424, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratris me quidem Piget pudetque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum me civitatis morum piget taedetque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: non dedisse ipsum pudet; <cit><quote lang="la">me, quia non accepi, piget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: nisi forte pudet aut piget recte facere, Sall. Or. contr. Lep. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam postea quae fecerit incertum habeo, pudeat magis an pigeat disserere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> J. 95, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longos castrorum ferre dolores si piget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:199" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim me piguit quaerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Silanum non piguerit sententiam suam interpretatione lenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pigitum parvos lares ... subire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:173" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 173</bibl></cit>; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non te pigeat visitare infirmum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 7, 39</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud quod piget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum id esse non negat, Neque se id pigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratione multitudo ad misericordiam inducitur, ad pudendum, ad pigendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:50:188" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 50, 188</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36275.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36275.4" n="1" level="3"> For poenitet, <hi rend="ital">it repents</hi> one; <hi rend="ital">I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">repent</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pigere interdum pro tardari, interdum pro poenitere poni solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=213" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 213</bibl></cit> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=212" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 212</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid plus minusve faxit, quod nos post pigeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigere eum facti coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto vos hujus omnis injuriae pigeret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 199, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36275.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">It makes</hi> one <hi rend="ital">ashamed; I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">am ashamed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fateri pigebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 296, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piger: <entryFree id="n36276" type="main" key="pi^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭger</orth>, <itype>gra, grum</itype> (late Lat. collat. form of <sense id="n36276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> pigrissimus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Castit. 13</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>piget</etym>. </sense><sense id="n36276.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unwilling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reluctant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">averse</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">gens pigerrima ad militaria opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigriores ad facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 13, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigriores ad cetera munia exequenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:9:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: ad litteras scribendas pigerrimus, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad conatus magnos piger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36276.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36276.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Backward</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lazy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inactive</hi> (of persons and things). </sense><sense id="n36276.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">interdum piger, interdum timidus in re militari videbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36276.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus ipsā mole piger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare pigrum ac prope immotum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>flowing slowly</tr>, <tr>sluggish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigrum mare et grave,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:61" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <trans><tr>that moves lazily</tr>, <tr>passes slowly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <trans><tr>that advances slowly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:727" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campus,</quote> <trans><tr>unfruitful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigriora sunt ista remedia,</quote> <trans><tr>operate too slowly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:17:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vult et non vult piger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicit piger, leo est in viā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigrā munire castra dolabrā,</quote> <trans><tr>lazily handled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:248" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 248</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n36276.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">militiae piger et malus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:264" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpit Arar per rura pigerrimus undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:504" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 504</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36276.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">piger scribendi ferre laborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit> (cf. the opp.: <cit><quote lang="la">impiger hostium Vexare turmas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 14, 22</bibl></cit>).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigrum et iners videtur sudore adquirere quod possis sanguine parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf., </sense><sense id="n36276.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sluggish</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that makes sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benumbing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sopor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:29" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36276.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispirited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dejected</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sad</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postclass. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigrum aliquem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:104:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 104, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piger tristisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n36276.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfeeling</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">hinc fessos subrepsit in artus Insidiosa quies et pigrae oblivio vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:56 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 56 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">indigna est pigro forma perire situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭgrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">slowly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in servitutem transiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigre ac segniter agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 434</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piget: <entryFree id="n36277" type="main" key="pi^get"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭget</orth>, v. pigeo.</entryFree>
pigmentarius: <entryFree id="n36278" type="main" key="pigmenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pigmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pigmentum</etym>, <sense id="n36278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to paints</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unguents</hi>: institor pigmentarius, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in paints</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unguents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. Comp. 22" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. Comp. 22</bibl>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n36278.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pigmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in paints</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unguents</hi>: pigmentarius, <foreign lang="greek">xrwmatopw/lhs, farmakopw/lhs, muropw/lhs</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">Attius pigmentarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 3</bibl>; Firm. Math. 8, 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; Pelag. Vet. 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:37:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 37, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pigmentatus: <entryFree id="n36279" type="main" key="pigmenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pigmentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">painted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colored</hi>, Tert. Cult. Fem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 316</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pigmentum: <entryFree id="n36280" type="main" key="pigmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pigmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pingo</etym>, <sense id="n36280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a material</hi> <cb n="PIGN" /> <hi rend="ital">for coloring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pigment.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36280.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36280.2" n="A" level="2"> For painting, <hi rend="ital">a paint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspersa temere pigmenta in tabulā, oris lineamenta efficere possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela in cortinam pigmenti ferventis mersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 42, § 150</bibl></cit>.—Jocosely: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Apelles Zeuxisque duo pingent pigmentis ulmeis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>beat black and blue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n36280.3" n="2" level="3"> For cosmetics, <hi rend="ital">a paint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pigment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non istanc aetatem oportet pigmentum ullum attingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 84, § 233</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplicasti pigmenta tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:57:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 57, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36280.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the juice</hi> of plants (post-class.), Firm. Math. 8, 17; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:46" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 46</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36280.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style, <hi rend="ital">coloring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornament</hi>: meus autem liber totum Isocratis <foreign lang="greek">muroqh/kion</foreign> atque omnes ejus discipulorum arculas et nonnihil etiam Aristotelia pigmenta consumpsit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigmentorum flos et color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:87:298" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 87, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae, tam verae, tam sine pigmentis fucoque puerili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pigneraticius: <entryFree id="n36281" type="main" key="pigne^ra_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pignĕrātīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pignŏ-rātīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pignero</etym>, <sense id="n36281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a pledge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>given as a pledge</tr>, <tr>pledged</tr>, <tr>mortgaged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditor,</quote> <trans><tr>who lends on a pledge</tr>, <tr>a pawnbroker</tr>, <tr>mortgagee</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:15" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 39, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: actio, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pignĕrātīcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an action on account of a pledge</hi>, which the debtor demands back again from the creditor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:9:3" default="NO">13, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:11:2" default="NO">13, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:6:28" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 6, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or for a pledge which the creditor demands from the debtor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:32" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:24" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 7, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pigneratio: <entryFree id="n36282" type="main" key="pigne^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pignĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pledging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pawning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortgaging</hi> (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pignerationem recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 34, 3, § 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pignerator: <entryFree id="n36283" type="main" key="pigne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pignĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who takes a pledge; a pledgee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortgagee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pignero: <entryFree id="n36284" type="main" key="pigne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pignĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pignus</etym>, <sense id="n36284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to give as a pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pawn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortgage.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36284.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">unionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7</bibl></cit>: bona tantum, quae publicari poterant, pigneranda poenae praebebant, <hi rend="ital">furnished as security for the penalty</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">left to be confiscated</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus et alveolos et laenam pignerat Atreus,</quote> <trans><tr>which the poet Rubrenus</tr>, <tr>while he was writing the Atreus</tr>, <tr>was compelled by necessity to pawn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancilla pignerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenta pignorata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36284.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36284.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pledge</hi> one's life, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">velut obsidibus datis pigneratos habere animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36284.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bind</hi> a person or thing <hi rend="ital">to one's self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make one's own</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignerare aliquem sibi beneficio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 134, 32</bibl></cit>: optimates viros curiae suae, Naz. Pan. ad Const. 35.—With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pledge one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cenae alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to promise to dine with one</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 269, 25.</sense></entryFree>
pigneror: <entryFree id="n36285" type="main" key="pigne^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pignĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n36285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [id.]. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to take as a pledge;</hi> hence, trop., </sense><sense id="n36285.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make one's own</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to appropriate</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Mars ipse ex acie fortissimum quemque pignerari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximas ingenii, consilii partes sibi ad utilitatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit> (cited in <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 477, 31 sq.</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">fidem militum praemio pigneratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36285.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To accept as certain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod das mihi, pigneror, omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 621</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pignoraticius: <entryFree id="n36286" type="main" key="pigno^ra_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pignŏrātīcĭus</orth>, v. pigneraticius.</entryFree>
pignoriscapio: <entryFree id="n36287" type="hapax" key="pigno^risca^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pignŏriscăpĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pignus-capio</etym>, <sense id="n36287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seizing as a pledge</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 10, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pignosa: <entryFree id="n36288" type="gloss" key="pigno^sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pignŏsa</orth>, v. pignus <sense id="n36288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pignus: <entryFree id="n36289" type="main" key="pignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pignus</orth>, <itype>ŏris and ĕris</itype> (old form in <number>plur.</number>: <sense id="n36289.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">pignosa pignora eodem modo quo valesii, auselii ... dicebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=213" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 213</bibl></cit> Müll.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root pac-, of pango; cf. paciscor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pawn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortgage</hi> (of persons as well as things). </sense><sense id="n36289.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opponere se pigneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager oppositus est pignori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus, quem hic reliqueram Pignus pro me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facto pignore animos centurionum devinxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem alicujus pignori accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignora apud se deposita persequi et vindicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub pignoribus mutuas pecunias accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere aliquid pignori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 20, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberare pignus a creditore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:4:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 20, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignoribus cavere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:3:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: aurum <pb n="1376" /> <cb n="PIGR" /> pignori apud aliquem ponere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:27" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 13, 7, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viginti milia faenus pignoribus positis,</quote> <trans><tr>income from mortgages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 141</bibl></cit>.—Esp., of the security for the payment of his fine, which was taken by the consul of a senator who failed to attend in the Senate: <cit><quote lang="la">pignus auferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: pignoribus terreri, Crass. ib.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">senatores pignoribus cogere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignora capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of hostages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marium pignora,</quote> <trans><tr>male hostages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>: pignus praetorium, <hi rend="ital">the security which the prœtor took as a guarantee for the preservation of a thing when he put it in the possession of a creditor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">or</hi> fidei commissarius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:5:12" default="NO">41, 5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36289.2" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in phrases. </sense><sense id="n36289.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Pignus capere, <hi rend="ital">to take a pledge</hi> or <hi rend="ital">security</hi> for payment: <cit><quote lang="la">certis verbis pignus capiebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:29" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:26 al" default="NO">26 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n36289.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Pignora capere, <hi rend="ital">to issue execution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make seizure of property</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vettium, pignoribus captis, cojecit in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum, qui debita confessi sunt, pignora capi et distrahi possunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 5</bibl></cit> A, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">per vim debitoris sui pignora, cum non haberet obligata, capere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36289.5" n="(g)" level="5"> Pignoris capio, <hi rend="ital">a proceeding by which the summary collection of certain debts was secured</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:26" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 26</bibl> (v. Sandars ad Just. Inst. introd. § 96).—</sense><sense id="n36289.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36289.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The object of a wager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wager</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stake</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">da pignus, ni ea sit filia,</quote> <trans><tr>lay a wager</tr>, <tr>bet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illo dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignore certare cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quovis pignore contendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to lay any wager</tr>, <tr>bet any thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quaerit posito pignore vincat uter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quodvis pignus vocare, ni, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere pignus cum aliquo de re aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36289.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A contract in which security is given</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:6:3" default="NO">20, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36289.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36289.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assurance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum pignus ab eo rei publicae datum, se, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignora voluntatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reconciliatae gratiae pignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:35" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignora da, genitor, per quae tua vera propago Credar,</quote> <trans><tr>sure tokens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 247</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 497</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vultu pignora mentis habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digito pignus fortasse dedisti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a ring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:27" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36289.11" n="B" level="2"> Concr. </sense><sense id="n36289.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Children</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brothers and sisters</hi>, <hi rend="ital">relatives</hi>, as pledges of love (only after the Aug. period): <cit><quote lang="la">nunc tibi commendo communia pignora, natos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 73; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 543</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prolemque gemellam Pignora bina dedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot natos natasque et pignora cara nepotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ascita pignora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:86" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pignora conjugum ac liberorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecratio illa judicum, per carissima pignora, utique, si et reo sint liberi, conjux, parentes, utilis erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habens filiam, uxorem, nepotem, sorores, interque tot pignora veros amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proxima pignora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in conjugem, in familiam, in cetera pignora ejus saeviret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frangi aspectu pignorum suorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 38</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in gen., </sense><sense id="n36289.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing especially valuable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis post pignera tanta Pompeio locus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 376</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36289.14" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">a graft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Insit. 109</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pigre: <entryFree id="n36290" type="main" key="pi^gre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭgrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. piger <sense id="n36290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
pigredo: <entryFree id="n36291" type="main" key="pi_^gre_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pī^grēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>piger</etym>, <sense id="n36291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sloth fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolence</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 19, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pigreo: <entryFree id="n36292" type="main" key="pi_^gre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pī^grĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reluctant</hi> (ante-class.): post aetate pigret sufferre laborem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 219, 12</bibl> (Ann. v. 405 Vahl.): omnes gaudent facere recte, male pigrent, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pigresco: <entryFree id="n36293" type="main" key="pi_^gresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pī^gresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n36293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [pigreo], <hi rend="ital">to become slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus pigrescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 18, 47, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possit pigrescere Cyllenius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Virg. 17, 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Luc. 10, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pigritas: <entryFree id="n36294" type="gloss" key="pi_^gri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pī^grĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>piger</etym>, <sense id="n36294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slothfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolence</hi>: pigritas, <foreign lang="greek">a)rgi/a</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
pigritia: <entryFree id="n36295" type="main" key="pi_^gri^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pī^grĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pī^grĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laziness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolence</hi> (cf.: desidia, socordia, inertia, segnities). </sense><sense id="n36295.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigritiam definiunt metum consequentis laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter pigritiam aut ignaviam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli putare pigritiā me facere, quod non meā manu scribam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 15</bibl></cit>: et haesitatio,<cb n="PILA" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox Romanis pigritiem ad sequendum fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:42:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 42, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lentae crimine pigritiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:79:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 79, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36295.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36295.3" n="1" level="3"> Tu das ingenuae jus mihi pigritiae, <hi rend="ital">honorable repose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leisure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36295.4" n="2" level="3"> Stomachi, <hi rend="ital">weakness of the stomach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pigritor: <entryFree id="n36296" type="main" key="pi_^gri^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pī^grĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n36296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [pigror], <hi rend="ital">to be slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sluggish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tardy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 9, 38</bibl>: <foreign lang="greek">*)/wknhsa</foreign>, pigritatus sum, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
pigro: <entryFree id="n36297" type="main" key="pi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pī^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>piger</etym>, <sense id="n36297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be indolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dilatory</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 410</bibl>: melius pigrasse quam properasse est hoc nefas, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 154, 2</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 144 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">cur propter haec pigrem?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 153, 32</bibl></cit> (Trag. Rel. p. 147 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
pigror: <entryFree id="n36298" type="hapax" key="pi_^gror1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pī^gror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be slow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dilatory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu scribere ne pigrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36299" type="main" key="pi_^gror2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pī^gror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sluggishness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indolence</hi> (ante-class.): obrepsit pigror torporque, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 219, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
piguus: <entryFree id="n36300" type="gloss" key="pi^gu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭgŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pigeo</etym>, <sense id="n36300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indolent</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 635</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
pila: <entryFree id="n36301" type="main" key="pi_la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. for pisula, from root pis-; v. pinso, piso</etym>, <sense id="n36301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mortar</hi> (syn. mortarium): <cit><quote lang="la">pila, ubi triticum pinsant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:573" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 573</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">zeae granum tunditur in pilā ligneā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si contuderis stultum in pilā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:27:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 27, 22</bibl></cit>: sal sordidum in pilā pisatum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=158" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 158</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36302" type="main" key="pi_la^2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlă</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for pigla, from root pag-, pig-, of pango, pe-pig-i, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n36302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pillar</hi> (syn. columna): pila, quae parietem sustentat, ab opponendo dicta est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=204" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 204</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">locavit pilas pontis in Tiberim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salax taberna a pileatis nona fratribus pila, of the temple of Castor and Pollux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 1</bibl></cit>: nulla taberna meos habeat neque pila libellos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">they are not to be publicly sold</hi> (as the booksellers had their stalls around the pillars of public buildings), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilas operibus subdere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:302" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 302</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 10, 10, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:61:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 61, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36302.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pier</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mole</hi> of stone: <cit><quote lang="la">saxea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 711</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:297" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 297</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36303" type="main" key="pi^la3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n36303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> pilaï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 713</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:720" default="NO" valid="yes">720</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:726" default="NO" valid="yes">726</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; perh. akin to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pa/llw</foreign>, brandish; Lat. pellere, drive; v. Corss. 1, 525 sqq.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">playing-ball</hi> (syn. follis). </sense><sense id="n36303.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pilā expulsim ludere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 104, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di nos quasi pilas homines habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilae studio teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lapsa e manibus fugit pila,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 149</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12</bibl> (4, 13), 5: <cit><quote lang="la">pila cadit aut mittentis vitio, aut accipientis . . . (pila) jactata et excepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:17:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilam scite et diligenter excipere . . . apte et expedite remittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:32:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilam repetere, quae terram contigit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddere pilam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:46:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 46, 2</bibl></cit>. There were four sorts of pilæ: <cit><quote lang="la">trigonalis, paganica, follis, harpastum.—Prov.: mea pila est,</quote> <trans><tr>I have the ball</tr>, <tr>I have caught it</tr>, <tr>I've won</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claudus pilam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 28, 69</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. claudus: Fortunae pila,</quote> <trans><tr>the foot-ball of fortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 18" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36303.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36303.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The game of ball</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum alii tribuunt alveolo, quantum pilae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36303.4" n="B" level="2"> Of any thing round, <hi rend="ital">a ball</hi> or <hi rend="ital">globe</hi> of any material: <cit><quote lang="la">pilae lanuginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 10, 21, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scarabaei e fimo ingentes pilas aversi pedibus volutant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 98</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">globe</hi> of the earth (ante-class.): in terrae pila, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 333, 25</bibl>.—The ancients made use of a glass or crystal ball filled with water as a burning-glass: <cit><quote lang="la">cum addită aquā vitreae pilae sole adverso in tantum excandescunt, ut vestes exurant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 26, 67, § 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 2, 10, § 28</bibl>.—The Roman ladies carried a crystal or amber ball to keep their hands cool, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18:60" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18, 60</bibl> (3, 18, 12); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 8</bibl>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">ball</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lump</hi> of earth which adheres to the roots of a bush when torn up, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9</bibl>. —Of the <hi rend="ital">ballots</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bails</hi> used by judges in voting, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 11, 19; Ascon. Argum. Milon. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Of stuffed <hi rend="ital">balls</hi> or <hi rend="ital">human figures</hi>: pilae et effigies viriles et muliebres ex lanā Compitalibus suspendebantur in compitis. quod hunc diem festum esse deorum inferorum quos vocant Lares, putarent: quibus tot pilae, quot capita servorum; tot effigies, quot essent liberi. ponebantur, ut vivis parcerent et essent his pilis et simulacris contenti, Paul. ex Fest. <cb n="PILL" /> p. 239 Müll. Bulls were baited by throwing similar <hi rend="ital">stuffed figures</hi> at their heads, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 19:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 19, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantus erat cornu, cui pila taurus erat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:ib. 9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, sed cui primus erat lusor dum floruit aetas, Nunc postquam desiit ludere prima pila est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:ib. 10:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 86</bibl></cit>. As these effigies were usually torn by the throwing, the term is also applied to a <hi rend="ital">torn toga</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36303.5" n="C" level="2"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">pilae Nursicae, i. e. rapae rotundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:20:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pilanus: <entryFree id="n36304" type="main" key="pi_la_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pilum</etym>, <sense id="n36304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a triarius</hi>, one of the soldiers forming the third rank in battle: pilani pilis pugnantes, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=204" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 204</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pilani triarii quoque dicti quod in acie tertio ordine extremis subsidio deponebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 89</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:129" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pilaris: <entryFree id="n36305" type="main" key="pi^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>3. pila</etym>, <sense id="n36305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a ball</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusio,</quote> <trans><tr>a game of ball</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
pilarium: <entryFree id="n36306" type="gloss" key="pi^la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. pila</etym>, <sense id="n36306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a burialplace where the ashes of the dead were deposited in cylindrical vases</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 13</bibl>, LII.</sense></entryFree>
pilarius: <entryFree id="n36307" type="main" key="pi^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>3. pila</etym>, <sense id="n36307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who performs tricks with balls</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ball-thrower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">juggler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2590</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hierosalpinctes, pilarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> 173</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pilastilus: <entryFree id="n36308" type="gloss" key="pilastilus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pilastilus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, perh. <sense id="n36308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a javelinmaker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 538</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pilates: <entryFree id="n36309" type="main" key="pilates"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pilates</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">pellates</orth>, only in <case>nom.</case> [cf. <foreign lang="greek">pello/s</foreign>, pallidus], <sense id="n36309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis genus, cujus meminit Cato originum l. V.: lapis candidior quam pilates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=237" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 237</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pilatim: <entryFree id="n36310" type="main" key="pi_la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>2. pila</etym>, <sense id="n36310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pillar-wise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with pillars.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36310.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilatim aedificia agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36310.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">in close bodies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in solid columns</hi>: sive pilatim, sive passim iter facere volebat, Asellio ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 121</bibl>: pilatim exercitum duxi, Scaur. ib.; cf. 1. pilo, and, under it, pilatus.</sense></entryFree>
pilatrix: <entryFree id="n36311" type="hapax" key="pi^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. pilo</etym>, <sense id="n36311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that robs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plunders</hi>: pilatrix pallii, Tit. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 102, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pilatus: <entryFree id="n36312" type="main" key="pi_la_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. 1. pilo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36313" type="main" key="pi_la_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pilum</etym>, <sense id="n36313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armed with javelins</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36314" type="main" key="Pi_la_tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīlātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> esp., Pontius Pilatus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman governor of Judœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of Jesus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 27, 2</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pilentum: <entryFree id="n36315" type="main" key="pi_lentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an easy chariot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">carriage</hi>, used by the Roman ladies, and in which the vessels, etc., for sacred rites were carried (cf. petorrita): <cit><quote lang="la">pilentis et carpentis per urbem vehi matronis concessum est, quod, cum aurum non reperiretur, ex voto, quod Camillus voverat Apollini Delphico, contulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=245" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 245</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castae ducebant sacra per urbem Pilentis matres in mollibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 666</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pileo: <entryFree id="n36316" type="main" key="pi_le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlĕo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pīlĕus</orth>, etc., v. pilleo, pilleus, etc.</entryFree>
pilicrepus: <entryFree id="n36317" type="main" key="pi^li_cre^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭlīcrĕpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>3. pila-crepo</etym>, <sense id="n36317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ballplayer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 56, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2591</bibl>; cf. Morcell. Stil. Inscr. Lat. 1, p. 454 Patav.</sense></entryFree>
pilleatus: <entryFree id="n36318" type="main" key="pille^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pillĕātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">pīle-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pilleus</etym>, <sense id="n36318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">covered with the</hi> pilleus or <hi rend="ital">felt-cap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wearing the</hi> pilleus (this was worn in Rome at entertainments, shows, and festivals, esp. at the Saturnalia; <cit><quote lang="la">slaves received it at their manumission as a token of freedom): pilleati aut lana alba velatis capitibus volones epulati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonorum turba pilleatorum currum sequentium, like a general's freedmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 23</bibl></cit>: nec per omnia nos similes esse pilleatae turbae voluisses, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Roman populace</hi>, who wore the pilleus at the Saturnalia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18, 3</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pilleata Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:6:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: tantum gaudium (mors Neronis) publice praebuit, ut plebs pilleata totā urbe discurreret (as a sign of liberation from slavery). <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 57</bibl>: ad Parthos procul ite pilleatos, <hi rend="ital">the bonneted Parthians</hi>, of whose ordinary apparel the pilleus was a part, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:72:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 72, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 13:3" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.
