Nol.</author> Carm. 17, 242</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilleati fratres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Castor and Pollux</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 2</bibl></cit>: pilleati servi. <hi rend="ital">bonneted slaves</hi>, i. e. slaves offered for sale with a pilleus on, to indicate that the seller did not warrant them, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 4, 1</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
pilleo: <entryFree id="n36319" type="main" key="pille^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pillĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id</etym>, <sense id="n36319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to place</hi> <pb n="1377" /> <cb n="PILU" /> <hi rend="ital">the</hi> pilleus <hi rend="ital">on</hi> a person's head, <hi rend="ital">to bonnet</hi> him, in token of manumission: pilleari et rudem accipere possunt, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 11, 7, 4.</sense></entryFree>
pilleolus: <entryFree id="n36320" type="main" key="pille^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pillĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pillĕŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>pilleus</etym>, <sense id="n36320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small felt cap</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a skull-cap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum pilleolo (portes) soleas conviva tribulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arbor. 25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arbor. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 85</bibl>, n. 6; 64, n. 13.</sense></entryFree>
pilleus: <entryFree id="n36321" type="main" key="pille^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pillĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pillĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>akin to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi=los</foreign>, with same signif.; also to pilus, a hair</etym>, <sense id="n36321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a felt cap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hat</hi>, made to fit close, and shaped like the half of an egg. It was worn by the Romans at entertainments and festivals, esp. at the Saturnalia, and was given to a slave at his enfranchisement as a sign of freedom (cf. petasus). </sense><sense id="n36321.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pilleum quem habuit deripuit, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Amph. 1, 1, 305</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mera libertas, hanc nobis pillea donant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 82</bibl></cit>. Free-born persons who had fallen into captivity also wore the pilleus for a while after the recovery of their freedom, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl> and 6. Gladiators who had often been victorious also received the pilleus at their discharge, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 21</bibl>. There were also leathern pillei, called Pannonian, which were worn by soldiers when off duty, in order that, by being always accustomed to wear something on their heads, the helmet might seem less burdensome, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 1, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36321.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36321.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Liberty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freedom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos ad pilleum vocare,</quote> <trans><tr>to summon the slaves to freedom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis pillea sarcinis redemi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I have made myself independent by selling all my goods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:68:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 68, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36321.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A protector</hi>: te obsecro, Pilleum meum, mi sodalis, mea salubritas, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 220, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36321.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The membrane which envelops the head of the fœtus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a child's caul</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Diadum. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pilo: <entryFree id="n36322" type="main" key="pi_lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlo</orth>, no <sense id="n36322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">pile/w</foreign>, qs. <hi rend="ital">to ram down;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to thrust home</hi> (ante-class. and rare): hastam pilans prae pondere frangit, Host. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 121</bibl> (pilans id est figens, Serv.). —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">closepressed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dense</hi> = densus, pressus. </sense><sense id="n36322.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pilatum (agmen), quod sine jumentis incedit, sed inter se densum est, quo facilius per iniquiora loca tramittatur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 121</bibl>: inde loci liquidas pilatasque aetheris oras Contemplor, Enn. ib. (firmas et stabiles significat et quasi pilis fultas, Serv.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 155</bibl> Vahl.).— </sense><sense id="n36322.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: sententia praesto pectore pilata, Hostius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 12, 121</bibl> (id est fixa, Serv.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36323" type="main" key="pi^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n36323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [1. pilus]. </sense><sense id="n36323.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put forth hairs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to grow hairy</hi>: pilat pilos habere incipit, ahas pro detrahit pilos, a quo depilati, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=204" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 204</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pilare dictum est, ut plumare, pilis vestiri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 39, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus meum nunc pilare primum coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:39:27" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> 39, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:39:28" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> 39, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36323.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">yilo/w</foreign>). </sense><sense id="n36323.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deprive of hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make bald</hi>, <hi rend="ital">depilate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:56:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 56, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 32, 33</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36323.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to plunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillage</hi> (very rare, and not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas compilare is class.): castra inimica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilati caesique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malam parram pilavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43, 4</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
pilosus: <entryFree id="n36324" type="main" key="pi^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hairy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaggy</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">villosus, setosus): ovis ventrem habet pilosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilosiora folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 16, 64, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursis asperior pilosiorque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Esau,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 11</bibl></cit>. —Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭlōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a shaggy person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">creature</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a satyr</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 13, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pilula: <entryFree id="n36325" type="main" key="pi^lu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭlŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>3. pila</etym>, <sense id="n36325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ball</hi>, <hi rend="ital">globule.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36325.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 7, 10, § 28</bibl>; Pelag. Vet. 14.—</sense><sense id="n36325.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in medicine, <hi rend="ital">a pill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 37, § 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pilum: <entryFree id="n36326" type="main" key="pi_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for pis-lum, cf. piso, 1. pila, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n36326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pounder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pestle</hi> of a mortar. </sense><sense id="n36326.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum fabarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl>: quasi tollenonem aut pilum Graecum reciproces planā viā, <hi rend="ital">a pounder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in using which</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one side was raised while the other was depressed</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. s v. reciprocare, p. 274 Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">pinsente pilo praeferrato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilo contusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 27, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36326.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the heavy javelin of the Roman infantry</hi>, <cb n="PIMP" /> which they hurled at the enemy at the commencement of the action, and then took to their swords: <cit><quote lang="la">(caput) adfixum gestari jussit in pilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum, haud paulo quam hasta, vehementius ictu missuque telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites e loco superiore pilis missis facile hostium phalangem perfregerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilorum hastarumque honore circumdatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in imperatorem suum legiones pila torserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 7</bibl>: pilum praepilatum, <hi rend="ital">having a blunt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rounded end</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 72. They were also used in sieges, being hurled at the enemy from the walls; <cit><quote lang="la">these were called pila muralia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum inicere alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to make an attack on one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36326.3" n="B" level="2"> Vis certe pila, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be</hi> primipilus <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> triarii or <hi rend="ital">veterans who carried two javelins each</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 94</bibl>; v. Dict. of Antiq. p. 104.</sense></entryFree>
pilumnoepoploe: <entryFree id="n36327" type="gloss" key="pilumnoe poploe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pilumnoe poploe</orth> <itype>in carmine Saliari Romani, velut pilis uti assueti, vel quia praecipue pellant hostes</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=205" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 205</bibl> Müll. [the former is undoubtedly the correct derivation; the singular still occurs in Pilumnus; v. h. v. sub Picumnus].</entryFree>
pilumnus: <entryFree id="n36328" type="main" key="Pi_lumnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīlumnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Picumnus.</entryFree>
pilus: <entryFree id="n36329" type="main" key="pi^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hair</hi> (syn.: villus, seta). </sense><sense id="n36329.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">capra pilos ministrat ad usum nauticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitae sunt palpebrae vallo pilorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudae pilos equinae vellere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duris aspera crura pilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra pilum equum fricare, Pelag. Vet. 26: in capite homini plurimus pilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 47, § 130</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">non minus molestum est calvis quam comatis pilos velli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 8:2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propius quidem est a sole mons quam campus aut valles, sed sic, quomodo est pilus pilo crassior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36329.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36329.3" n="A" level="2"> Collect., <hi rend="ital">hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruticante pilo neglecta et squalida crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36329.4" n="B" level="2"> As a designation of insignificance, <hi rend="ital">a hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle;</hi> usually joined with a negative, <hi rend="ital">not a hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not a bit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not a whit</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego ne pilo quidem minus me amabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interea e Cappadociā ne pilum quidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ullum pilum viri boni habere dicatur,</quote> <trans><tr>has not a hair of a good man about him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non facit pili cohortem,</quote> <trans><tr>does not value it a straw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pili facit uni,</quote> <trans><tr>cares not a pin about it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 16</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">a garment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fabric made of hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestitus pilis cameli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36330" type="main" key="pi_lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>pilum</etym>, regularly joined with <sense id="n36330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">primus</hi>: primus pilus (in the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> written also as one word, primipili), <hi rend="ital">the division of the</hi> triarii <hi rend="ital">in the Roman army</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Sextius Baculus, primi pili centurio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 13</bibl>: T. Balventius, qui superiore anno primum pilum duxerat, <hi rend="ital">had been leader</hi>, <hi rend="ital">captain of the</hi> triarii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 34, 11</bibl>: aliquem ad primum pilum transducere, <hi rend="ital">to transfer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">advance to the</hi> triarii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:53:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 53, 5</bibl>: primos pilos ademit, <hi rend="ital">took the command of the</hi> triarii, <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> primipili, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus consuetudo tenuit, ut ex primo principe legionis promeretur centurio primi pili, qui non solum aquilae praeerat, verum etiam quatuor centurias in primā acie gubernabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—Without <hi rend="ital">primus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">referes pili praemia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:58:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 58, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:32:3" default="NO">1, 32, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36330.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: primipilus (in inscrr. also written PRIMOPIL, and abbrev. P. P.), <hi rend="ital">the chief centurion of the</hi> triarii (the transf. arose from the circumstance that the chief centurion of this division was originally designated by the term primi pili, with the omission of the easily supplied centurio, as is shown by the following citation from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">soon, however, from primi pili, a new word, primipilus or primopilus, was formed): primus centurio erat, quem nunc primi pili appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primipilo P. Sext. Baculo vulneribus confecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilarum altera vix convelli a primipilo potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>; Inscr. (of the time of Trajan) Orell. 799: SEX. AVLIENO SEX. F. PRIMOPIL. II., Inscr. (of the time of Tiberius or Caligula) Orell. 3426 M. P.; cf. Becker, Antiq. 3, 3, p. 264.</sense></entryFree>
pimpleis: <entryFree id="n36331" type="main" key="Pimple_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pimplēis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Piplēis</orth>), <itype>ĭdis and ĭdos</itype>, <sense id="n36331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pimplhi+s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Pimpla</hi><cb n="PIND" />  (a place and fountain in Pieria sacred to the Muses, now <hi rend="ital">Litokhoro</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Pimplean;</hi> hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n36331.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The territory around Pimpla</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si riguam laetis recolis Pimpleida Musis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>if you devote yourself to the Muses</tr>, <tr>compose poetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 14, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36331.2" n="II" level="1"> (Sc. Musa.) <hi rend="ital">A Muse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Musae ab terrestribus locis aliis cognominatae Libethrides, Pimpleides, Thespiades, Heliconides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 20</bibl></cit> Müll.: Pimpleides Musae a fonte Macedoniae dictae propter liquoris ejus unicam subtilitatem, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=212" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 212</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pimpleus: <entryFree id="n36332" type="main" key="Pimple_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pimplēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Piplēus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n36332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Pimplean</hi> (v. Pimpleis); hence, <hi rend="ital">sacred to the Muses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:105:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 105, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:11:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pimplēa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Pi-plēa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n36332.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Muse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">necte meo Lamiae coronam, Pimplea dulcis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36332.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The fountain of Pimpla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:25" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pimplias: <entryFree id="n36333" type="main" key="Pimpli_^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pimplī^ăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pimplia/s</foreign>, <sense id="n36333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pimpliad</hi> (v. Pimpleis), i. e. <hi rend="ital">a Muse</hi> (in later poetry for the more usual Pimpleis): <cit><quote lang="la">hic et Pimpliadas induxerat optimus Orpheus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">22, 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pina: <entryFree id="n36334" type="main" key="pi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pi=na</foreign> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">pinna</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">pi/nna</foreign>), <sense id="n36334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sea-pen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of mussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 56, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:150" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 150</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinacotheca: <entryFree id="n36335" type="greek" key="pi^na^co^the_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭnăcŏthēca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭnăcŏ-thēcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pinakoqh/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n36335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a picture-gallery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut videant pinacothecas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in pinacothece faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:59:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 59, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celeberrimi pictores, quorum tabulae pinacothecas implent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">FLAVIVS APOLLONIVS QVI FVIT A PINACOTHECIS,</quote> <trans><tr>director of the picture-galleries</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 724</bibl></cit>, n. 443.</sense></entryFree>
pinarius: <entryFree id="n36336" type="main" key="Pi_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman sacerdotal family.</hi> The Pinarii and Potitii presided at the celebration of certain sacred rites in honor of Hercules, originally instituted by Evander and re-established by Romulus. The Pinarii having on one occasion arrived after the exta were consumed, it was ordained that, as long as the family remained, they should not partake of the exta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 12</bibl> sqq.; 9, 29, 9 sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=237" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 237</bibl> Müll. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Pinarii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Pinarian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pinaria domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pinaria gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Gent. R. 8" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Gent. R. 8</bibl></cit>: Pinaria tribus, Fest. s. v. popilia, p. 233 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
pinarus: <entryFree id="n36337" type="main" key="Pi_na^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pīnărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pi/naros</foreign>, <sense id="n36337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Cilicia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Deli Tchai</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:12:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 12, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinastellus: <entryFree id="n36338" type="main" key="pi_nastellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnastellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pinus</etym>, <sense id="n36338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> peucedanum, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinaster: <entryFree id="n36339" type="main" key="pi_naster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wild pine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinaster nihil aliud est, quam pinus silvestris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 16, § 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pinax: <entryFree id="n36340" type="greek" key="pi^nax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pĭnax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pi/nac</foreign>, <sense id="n36340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a picture on a wooden tablet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a picture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pinax Cebetis,</quote> <trans><tr>the title of a work by the Theban philosopher Cebes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Haeret. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pincerna: <entryFree id="n36341" type="greek" key="pincerna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pincerna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">pigke/rnhs</foreign> (v. Du Cange, Gloss. Graec. s. h. v.; prop. one who mixes drinks; hence, in gen.), <sense id="n36341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cupbearer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">butler</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Verr. 2:1:26" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Quaest. in Gen. 40, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2881</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:40:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 40, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl> Esdr. 1, 11.</sense></entryFree>
pincius: <entryFree id="n36342" type="main" key="Pinci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pincĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n36342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, Grut. 352, 5. Perh. after them was named the Mons Pincius, <hi rend="ital">the eighth hill of Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situate outside the city</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but enclosed by the Aurelian wall;</hi> called, at an earlier period, Collis hortorum, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Pincio.</hi> —Hence, </sense><sense id="n36342.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pincĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> Mons Pincius, <hi rend="ital">Pincian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pindarus: <entryFree id="n36343" type="main" key="Pinda^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pindărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pi/ndaros</foreign>. <sense id="n36343.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pindar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated lyric poet of Thebes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contemporary with Æschylus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:26:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 26, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36343.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n36343.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pindărĕ-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pindaric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pindaream chelyn referre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36343.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pin-dărĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Pindaric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Camenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pindaricos modos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:18:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:40" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: Pindaricum metrum, consisting of a trimeter brachycatalectus<pb n="1378" /> <cb n="PING" />  (e. g. medium rapido mare Tibris adit fluvio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centimetr. p. 1822</bibl> P.— </sense><sense id="n36343.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 619, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36343.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The freedman who held the sword upon which Cassius fell at Philippi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:8:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pindenissus: <entryFree id="n36344" type="main" key="Pinde^nissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pindĕnissus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n36344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified town in Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taken by Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 4, 10</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Pindĕnissae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Pindenissus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pindus: <entryFree id="n36345" type="main" key="Pindus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Pindus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*pi/ndos</foreign>, <sense id="n36345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lofty mountain in Thessaly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Macedonia and Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the seat of the Muses</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mezzara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othrysque Pindusque et Pindo major Olympus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga Pindi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super Pindo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pinea: <entryFree id="n36346" type="main" key="pi_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. pineus, II.</entryFree>
pinetum: <entryFree id="n36347" type="main" key="pi_ne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pinus</etym>, <sense id="n36347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pine-wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pine-grove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinctaque pinetis nemoris juga Nonacrini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:275" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 275</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 43, § 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pineus: <entryFree id="n36348" type="main" key="pi_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the pine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pine-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinea velamina,</quote> <trans><tr>pine-wreaths</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardor,</quote> <trans><tr>a fire of pine-wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:786" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 786</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga pinea,</quote> <trans><tr>a piny tract</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">claustra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the wooden horse before Troy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fert avidas in pinea Turnus Texta faces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>into the ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 530</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pinea moles,</quote> <trans><tr>a ship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">compages,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:76:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 76, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuclei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36348.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pine-nut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pine-cone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pineam serere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:239" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 239</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36348.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">a pine-cone; plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pingo: <entryFree id="n36349" type="main" key="pingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pingo</orth>, <itype>pinxi, pictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n36349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to represent pictorially</hi> with the pencil or needle, <hi rend="ital">to paint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embroider</hi> (cf.: depingo, delineo, adumbro). </sense><sense id="n36349.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (comas) Dione Pingitur sustinuisse manu,</quote> <trans><tr>is represented in painting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula picta,</quote> <trans><tr>a painting</tr>, <tr>picture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingere hominis speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:16:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 16, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Helenae simulacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nero princeps jusserat colosseum se pingi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 7, 33, § 51</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dicunt ii, qui numquam philosophum pictum, ut dicitur, viderunt, of those who speak of things they know nothing about,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:27:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 27, 80</bibl></cit>.— Of embroidering (with or without <hi rend="ital">acu</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">textile stragulum, magnificis operibus pictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingere acu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picti reges,</quote> <trans><tr>in embroidered garments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:72:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 72, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">picti tori,</quote> <trans><tr>with embroidered coverlets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <trans><tr>the embroidered toga worn by a triumphing commander</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tapetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 7, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">pingi,</quote> <trans><tr>to paint the face</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36349.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36349.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To paint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">color</hi> with any thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">palloribus omnia pingunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 311</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:375" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 375</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguineis frontem moris et tempora pingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:5:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multas facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:146" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 94</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oculos stibio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 4, 30</bibl></cit>. —Esp., <hi rend="ital">to tattoo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agathyrsi ora artusque pingunt iisdem omnes notis, et sic ut ablui nequeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membraque qui ferro gaudet pinxisse Gelonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 1, 313</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36349.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecam aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellis pingitur aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 310" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 310</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36349.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style, <hi rend="ital">to paint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">embellish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula, quam Cleanthes sane commode verbis depingere solebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus, quem ego varie meis orationibus soleo pingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo mihi date Britanniam, quam pingam coloribus tuis penicillo meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl></cit>, a, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc (virum) omnibus a me pictum et politum artis coloribus subito deformatum vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">pictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">painted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of various colors.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36349.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 525</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absint et picti squalentia terga lacerti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 663</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36349.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">tattooed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Geloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Agathyrsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 146</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. 302</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36349.8" n="2" level="3"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">ornamented</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ornate</hi>: orationis pictum et expolitum genus, Cic. Or. <cb n="PING" /> 27, 96: <cit><quote lang="la">Lysiā nihil potest esse pictius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 293</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36349.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Merely painted</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unreal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceptive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictos experiere metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 50.</sense></entryFree>
pinguamen: <entryFree id="n36350" type="gloss" key="pingua_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>pinguis</etym>, <sense id="n36350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> adv. Jud. 1, 16</bibl>; cf. pinguamen, <foreign lang="greek">li/pos</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
pinguedo: <entryFree id="n36351" type="main" key="pingue_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fatness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 15, 35, § 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36351.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">richness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:27:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 27, 28</bibl>; id. Job, 36, 16.—</sense><sense id="n36351.2" n="III" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">fulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">richness</hi> in expression (opp. exilitas), v. l. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl> (al. pinguetudine).</sense></entryFree>
pinguefacio: <entryFree id="n36352" type="main" key="pingue^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>pinguis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n36352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fatten</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 93, § 246</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguefactus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pinguesco: <entryFree id="n36353" type="main" key="pinguesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n36353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [pinguis], <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow fat.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36353.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">emaciatum armentum medicā (herbā) pinguescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">attilus (piscis) in Pado inertiā pinguescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:134" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 14, 36, § 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta pinguescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos sanguine,</quote> <trans><tr>grow fertile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 492</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36353.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36353.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To grow fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">oily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum Maroneum vetustate pinguescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces juglandes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 5, 30, § 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36353.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To become shining</hi>, like fat: <cit><quote lang="la">achates politurā pinguescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 65, § 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36353.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To aspirate</hi> in speaking: Aeolenses Graeci, in quibusdam dictionibus, ut pinguescant, digamma apponunt ut pro Elena dicunt Velena, Serg. p. 1827 P.—</sense><sense id="n36353.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow more violent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae pinguescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:354" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 354</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pinguiarius: <entryFree id="n36354" type="main" key="pingui^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who likes fat</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:100:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 100, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinguiculus: <entryFree id="n36355" type="hapax" key="pingui^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n36355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fattish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:12" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 12</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
pinguis: <entryFree id="n36356" type="main" key="pinguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root pag-, pak-, of pango, q. v.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">paxu/s</foreign>, stout</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">pi/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n36356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fat</hi> (opp. macer; syn.: opimus, obesus). </sense><sense id="n36356.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingues Thebani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingui tentus omaso Furius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me pinguem et nitidum bene curatā cute vises,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lateranus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:147" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguem facere gallinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguior agnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguissimus haedulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 65</bibl></cit>: merum, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oily wine</hi> (= plenum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 65</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pingue</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grease</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 85, § 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurorum, leonum ac pantherarum pinguia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 9, 38, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comedite pinguia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Esd. 8, 10.—</sense><sense id="n36356.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36356.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">plump</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in good condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 25</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine pinguior Campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>drawn in a rich soil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula, of beehives,</quote> <trans><tr>rich</tr>, <tr>full of honey</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <trans><tr>plump</tr>, <tr>juicy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 88</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">saliva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:38:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: flamma, of incense; <cit><quote lang="la">tura pingues facientia flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora suco pinguis olivae Splendescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingues taedae,</quote> <trans><tr>full of pitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingues arae,</quote> <trans><tr>full of fat and blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma,</quote> <trans><tr>anointed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:29:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 29, 5</bibl></cit> (different from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> 3): <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <trans><tr>rich</tr>, <tr>luxurious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incusa pingui auro dona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:52" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 52</bibl></cit>. —Of color, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faint</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 37, § 115</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that makes fat;</hi> hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">fertilizing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingui flumine Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36356.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bedaubed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besmeared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguia crura luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:247" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virga,</quote> <trans><tr>limed twigs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:55:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 55, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36356.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dense</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum pingue et concretum (opp. caelum tenue et purum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia pinguissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 29, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguissima coma,</quote> <trans><tr>very thick</tr>, <tr>luxuriant hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n36356.6" n="4" level="3"> Of taste, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insipid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not sharp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not pungent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 27, 32, § 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 28, 33, § 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36356.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n36356.8" n="A" level="2"> Of the mind, <hi rend="ital">dull</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gross</hi>, <hi rend="ital">heavy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doltish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cordubae natis poëtis pingue quiddam sonantibus et peregrinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingue videbatur et sibi contrarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 34, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prave factis decorari versibus opto, Ne rubeam pingui donatus munere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingue sed ingenium mansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insubidius nescio quid facies et pinguius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21</bibl></cit> (20), 4: pinguis<cb n="PINS" />  Minerva, v. Minerva.—</sense><sense id="n36356.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Siout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36356.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comfortable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">easy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">et pingui membra quiete levat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 206</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 13, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:19:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollem in posterum et pinguem destinare vitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguius otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36356.11" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sleek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spruce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trim</hi>, = nitidus: <cit><quote lang="la">pexus pinguisque doctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit> Spald.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n36356.12" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with fatness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n36356.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguius succurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36356.14" n="3" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stupidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguius aliquid accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:49" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pinguitia: <entryFree id="n36357" type="main" key="pingui^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>pinguis</etym>, <sense id="n36357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fatness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 226</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 245, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinguitudo: <entryFree id="n36358" type="main" key="pingui^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n36358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fatness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">richness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coarseness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rankness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36358.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: vere sus usque adeo pinguitudine crescere solet, ut, etc., Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 71, § 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 24, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36358.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">broadness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coarseness</hi> of pronunciation, opp. to exilitas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 4</bibl> (v. l. pinguedine).</sense></entryFree>
pinguiusculus: <entryFree id="n36359" type="main" key="pingui^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinguĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n36359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat fat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fattish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pinifer: <entryFree id="n36360" type="main" key="pi_ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pinus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n36360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pine-bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that produces pines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maenalus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atlantis caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
piniger: <entryFree id="n36361" type="main" key="pi_ni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pinus-gero</etym>, <sense id="n36361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pine-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:84" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Othrys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:393" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 393</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Simois,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:225" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pinna: <entryFree id="n36362" type="main" key="pinna1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. penna.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n36363" type="main" key="pinna2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinna</orth>, <sense id="n36363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of mussel;</hi> prop. <orth extent="full" lang="la">pīnă</orth>, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
pinnaculum: <entryFree id="n36364" type="main" key="pinna_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinnācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. pinna</etym>, <sense id="n36364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a peak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pinnacle</hi> of a building (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinnapes: <entryFree id="n36365" type="main" key="pinna^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinnăpes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pinna-pes</etym>, <sense id="n36365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">winged on the feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having winged feet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
pinnatus: <entryFree id="n36366" type="main" key="pinna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. pinna</etym>, <sense id="n36366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feathered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plumed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36366.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Jovis satelles Pinnatā caudā, old poet ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 24</bibl>: Musa pinnato gradu intulit se, Porc. Latro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:45" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36366.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">feathered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pinnate</hi>: abies folio pinnato densa, <hi rend="ital">feathered</hi>, i. e. having leaves that lie on each other like feathers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraxinus pinnata et ipsa folio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 13, 24, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:79" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 9, 55, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
pinnicillum: <entryFree id="n36367" type="spur" key="pinni^cillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinnĭcillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, for penicillum. <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 1</bibl>.</entryFree>
pinniger: <entryFree id="n36368" type="main" key="pinni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">pinnĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. pinnagero</etym>, <sense id="n36368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feather-bearing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">feathered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winged.</hi> </sense><sense id="n36368.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: pinnigero, non armigero in corpore tela exercentur, i. e. <hi rend="ital">against birds</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 33, 1</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 176 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1074" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1074</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n36368.2" n="II" level="1"> Transf, <hi rend="ital">having fins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">finny</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:963" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 963</bibl></cit>; Coripp. Johann. 4, 981.</sense></entryFree>
